{"title": "keyphrase extraction : enhancing lists", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "this paper proposes some modest improvements to extractor , a state-of-the-art keyphrase extraction system , by using a terabyte-sized corpus to estimate the informativeness and semantic similarity of keyphrases"], ["BODY", "we present two techniques to improve the organization and remove outliers of lists of keyphrases"], ["BODY", "the first is a simple ordering according to their occurrences in the corpus ; the second is clustering according to semantic similarity"], ["BODY", "evaluation issues are discussed"], ["BODY", "we present a novel technique of comparing extracted keyphrases to a gold standard which relies on semantic similarity rather than string matching or an evaluation involving human judges ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "text corpus"]}
{"title": "fame : face association through model evolution", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we attack the problem of learning face models for public faces from weakly-labelled images collected from web through querying a name"], ["BODY", "the data is very noisy even after face detection , with several irrelevant faces corresponding to other people"], ["BODY", "we propose a novel method , face association through model evolution ( fame ) , that is able to prune the data in an iterative way , for the face models associated to a name to evolve"], ["BODY", "the idea is based on capturing discriminativeness and representativeness of each instance and eliminating the outliers"], ["BODY", "the final models are used to classify faces on novel datasets with possibly different characteristics"], ["CONCLUSION", "on benchmark datasets , our results are comparable to or better than state-of-the-art studies for the task of face identification ."]], "topics": ["iteration", "relevance"]}
{"title": "recycling randomness with structure for sublinear time kernel expansions", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we propose a scheme for recycling gaussian random vectors into structured matrices to approximate various kernel functions in sublinear time via random embeddings"], ["BODY", "our framework includes the fastfood construction as a special case , but also extends to circulant , toeplitz and hankel matrices , and the broader family of structured matrices that are characterized by the concept of low-displacement rank"], ["BODY", "we introduce notions of coherence and graph-theoretic structural constants that control the approximation quality , and prove unbiasedness and low-variance properties of random feature maps that arise within our framework"], ["BODY", "for the case of low-displacement matrices , we show how the degree of structure and randomness can be controlled to reduce statistical variance at the cost of increased computation and storage requirements"], ["CONCLUSION", "empirical results strongly support our theory and justify the use of a broader family of structured matrices for scaling up kernel methods using random features ."]], "topics": ["kernel ( operating system )", "approximation algorithm"]}
{"title": "a unified framework for tumor proliferation score prediction in breast histopathology", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present a unified framework to predict tumor proliferation scores from breast histopathology whole slide images"], ["BODY", "our system offers a fully automated solution to predicting both a molecular data-based , and a mitosis counting-based tumor proliferation score"], ["BODY", "the framework integrates three modules , each fine-tuned to maximize the overall performance : an image processing component for handling whole slide images , a deep learning based mitosis detection network , and a proliferation scores prediction module"], ["CONCLUSION", "we have achieved 0.567 quadratic weighted cohen 's kappa in mitosis counting-based score prediction and 0.652 f1-score in mitosis detection"], ["CONCLUSION", "on spearman 's correlation coefficient , which evaluates predictive accuracy on the molecular data based score , the system obtained 0.6171"], ["CONCLUSION", "our approach won first place in all of the three tasks in tumor proliferation assessment challenge 2016 which is miccai grand challenge ."]], "topics": ["image processing"]}
{"title": "constrained deep metric learning for person re-identification", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "person re-identification aims to re-identify the probe image from a given set of images under different camera views"], ["INTRODUCTION", "it is challenging due to large variations of pose , illumination , occlusion and camera view"], ["INTRODUCTION", "since the convolutional neural networks ( cnn ) have excellent capability of feature extraction , certain deep learning methods have been recently applied in person re-identification"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , in person re-identification , the deep networks often suffer from the over-fitting problem"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel cnn-based method to learn a discriminative metric with good robustness to the over-fitting problem in person re-identification"], ["BODY", "firstly , a novel deep architecture is built where the mahalanobis metric is learned with a weight constraint"], ["BODY", "this weight constraint is used to regularize the learning , so that the learned metric has a better generalization ability"], ["BODY", "secondly , we find that the selection of intra-class sample pairs is crucial for learning but has received little attention"], ["BODY", "to cope with the large intra-class variations in pedestrian images , we propose a novel training strategy named moderate positive mining to prevent the training process from over-fitting to the extreme samples in intra-class pairs"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments show that our approach significantly outperforms state-of-the-art methods on several benchmarks of person re-identification ."]], "topics": ["feature extraction"]}
{"title": "gated-attention architectures for task-oriented language grounding", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "to perform tasks specified by natural language instructions , autonomous agents need to extract semantically meaningful representations of language and map it to visual elements and actions in the environment"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this problem is called task-oriented language grounding"], ["BODY", "we propose an end-to-end trainable neural architecture for task-oriented language grounding in 3d environments which assumes no prior linguistic or perceptual knowledge and requires only raw pixels from the environment and the natural language instruction as input"], ["BODY", "the proposed model combines the image and text representations using a gated-attention mechanism and learns a policy to execute the natural language instruction using standard reinforcement and imitation learning methods"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show the effectiveness of the proposed model on unseen instructions as well as unseen maps , both quantitatively and qualitatively"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also introduce a novel environment based on a 3d game engine to simulate the challenges of task-oriented language grounding over a rich set of instructions and environment states ."]], "topics": ["natural language", "map"]}
{"title": "target-quality image compression with recurrent , convolutional neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a stop-code tolerant ( sct ) approach to training recurrent convolutional neural networks for lossy image compression"], ["BODY", "our methods introduce a multi-pass training method to combine the training goals of high-quality reconstructions in areas around stop-code masking as well as in highly-detailed areas"], ["BODY", "these methods lead to lower true bitrates for a given recursion count , both pre- and post-entropy coding , even using unstructured lz77 code compression"], ["BODY", "the pre-lz77 gains are achieved by trimming stop codes"], ["BODY", "the post-lz77 gains are due to the highly unequal distributions of 0/1 codes from the sct architectures"], ["CONCLUSION", "with these code compressions , the sct architecture maintains or exceeds the image quality at all compression rates compared to jpeg and to rnn auto-encoders across the kodak dataset"], ["CONCLUSION", "in addition , the sct coding results in lower variance in image quality across the extent of the image , a characteristic that has been shown to be important in human ratings of image quality"]], "topics": ["encoder"]}
{"title": "structure learning in motor control : a deep reinforcement learning model", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "motor adaptation displays a structure-learning effect : adaptation to a new perturbation occurs more quickly when the subject has prior exposure to perturbations with related structure"], ["INTRODUCTION", "although this `learning-to-learn ' effect is well documented , its underlying computational mechanisms are poorly understood"], ["BODY", "we present a new model of motor structure learning , approaching it from the point of view of deep reinforcement learning"], ["BODY", "previous work outside of motor control has shown how recurrent neural networks can account for learning-to-learn effects"], ["BODY", "we leverage this insight to address motor learning , by importing it into the setting of model-based reinforcement learning"], ["CONCLUSION", "we apply the resulting processing architecture to empirical findings from a landmark study of structure learning in target-directed reaching ( braun et al"], ["CONCLUSION", ", 2009 ) , and discuss its implications for a wider range of learning-to-learn phenomena ."]], "topics": ["recurrent neural network", "reinforcement learning"]}
{"title": "model-based diagnosis using structured system descriptions", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "this paper presents a comprehensive approach for model-based diagnosis which includes proposals for characterizing and computing preferred diagnoses , assuming that the system description is augmented with a system structure ( a directed graph explicating the interconnections between system components )"], ["BODY", "specifically , we first introduce the notion of a consequence , which is a syntactically unconstrained propositional sentence that characterizes all consistency-based diagnoses and show that standard characterizations of diagnoses , such as minimal conflicts , correspond to syntactic variations on a consequence"], ["BODY", "second , we propose a new syntactic variation on the consequence known as negation normal form ( nnf ) and discuss its merits compared to standard variations"], ["BODY", "third , we introduce a basic algorithm for computing consequences in nnf given a structured system description"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that if the system structure does not contain cycles , then there is always a linear-size consequence in nnf which can be computed in linear time"], ["CONCLUSION", "for arbitrary system structures , we show a precise connection between the complexity of computing consequences and the topology of the underlying system structure"], ["CONCLUSION", "finally , we present an algorithm that enumerates the preferred diagnoses characterized by a consequence"], ["CONCLUSION", "the algorithm is shown to take linear time in the size of the consequence if the preference criterion satisfies some general conditions ."]], "topics": ["time complexity", "eisenstein 's criterion"]}
{"title": "a vision based system for underwater docking", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "autonomous underwater vehicles ( auvs ) have been deployed for underwater exploration"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , its potential is confined by its limited on-board battery energy and data storage capacity"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this problem has been addressed using docking systems by underwater recharging and data transfer for auvs"], ["BODY", "in this work , we propose a vision based framework for underwater docking following these systems"], ["BODY", "the proposed framework comprises two modules ; ( i ) a detection module which provides location information on underwater docking stations in 2d images captured by an on-board camera , and ( ii ) a pose estimation module which recovers the relative 3d position and orientation between docking stations and auvs from the 2d images"], ["BODY", "for robust and credible detection of docking stations , we propose a convolutional neural network called docking neural network ( donn )"], ["BODY", "for accurate pose estimation , a perspective-n-point algorithm is integrated into our framework"], ["BODY", "in order to examine our framework in underwater docking tasks , we collected a dataset of 2d images , named underwater docking images dataset ( udid ) , in an experimental water pool"], ["BODY", "to the best of our knowledge , udid is the first publicly available underwater docking dataset"], ["BODY", "in the experiments , we first evaluate performance of the proposed detection module on udid and its deformed variations"], ["BODY", "next , we assess the accuracy of the pose estimation module by ground experiments , since it is not feasible to obtain true relative position and orientation between docking stations and auvs under water"], ["BODY", "then , we examine the pose estimation module by underwater experiments in our experimental water pool"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results show that the proposed framework can be used to detect docking stations and estimate their relative pose efficiently and successfully , compared to the state-of-the-art baseline systems ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "autonomous car"]}
{"title": "deep hybrid similarity learning for person re-identification", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "person re-identification ( re-id ) aims to match person images captured from two non-overlapping cameras"], ["BODY", "in this paper , a deep hybrid similarity learning ( dhsl ) method for person re-id based on a convolution neural network ( cnn ) is proposed"], ["BODY", "in our approach , a cnn learning feature pair for the input image pair is simultaneously extracted"], ["BODY", "then , both the element-wise absolute difference and multiplication of the cnn learning feature pair are calculated"], ["BODY", "finally , a hybrid similarity function is designed to measure the similarity between the feature pair , which is realized by learning a group of weight coefficients to project the element-wise absolute difference and multiplication into a similarity score"], ["BODY", "consequently , the proposed dhsl method is able to reasonably assign parameters of feature learning and metric learning in a cnn so that the performance of person re-id is improved"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments on three challenging person re-id databases , qmul grid , viper and cuhk03 , illustrate that the proposed dhsl method is superior to multiple state-of-the-art person re-id methods ."]], "topics": ["feature learning", "convolution"]}

{"title": "tensor factorization via matrix factorization", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "tensor factorization arises in many machine learning applications , such knowledge base modeling and parameter estimation in latent variable models"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , numerical methods for tensor factorization have not reached the level of maturity of matrix factorization methods"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a new method for cp tensor factorization that uses random projections to reduce the problem to simultaneous matrix diagonalization"], ["BODY", "our method is conceptually simple and also applies to non-orthogonal and asymmetric tensors of arbitrary order"], ["CONCLUSION", "we prove that a small number random projections essentially preserves the spectral information in the tensor , allowing us to remove the dependence on the eigengap that plagued earlier tensor-to-matrix reductions"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimentally , our method outperforms existing tensor factorization methods on both simulated data and two real datasets ."]], "topics": ["numerical analysis", "simulation"]}
{"title": "a comparison on audio signal preprocessing methods for deep neural networks on music tagging", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "deep neural networks ( dnn ) have been successfully applied for music classification tasks including music tagging"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we investigate the effect of audio preprocessing on music tagging with neural networks"], ["BODY", "we perform comprehensive experiments involving audio preprocessing using different time-frequency representations , logarithmic magnitude compression , frequency weighting and scaling"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that many commonly used input preprocessing techniques are redundant except magnitude compression ."]], "topics": ["neural networks"]}
{"title": "gradient layer : enhancing the convergence of adversarial training for generative models", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we propose a new technique that boosts the convergence of training generative adversarial networks"], ["BODY", "generally , the rate of training deep models reduces severely after multiple iterations"], ["BODY", "a key reason for this phenomenon is that a deep network is expressed using a highly non-convex finite-dimensional model , and thus the parameter gets stuck in a local optimum"], ["BODY", "because of this , methods often suffer not only from degeneration of the convergence speed but also from limitations in the representational power of the trained network"], ["BODY", "to overcome this issue , we propose an additional layer called the gradient layer to seek a descent direction in an infinite-dimensional space"], ["BODY", "because the layer is constructed in the infinite-dimensional space , we are not restricted by the specific model structure of finite-dimensional models"], ["BODY", "as a result , we can get out of the local optima in finite-dimensional models and move towards the global optimal function more directly"], ["BODY", "in this paper , this phenomenon is explained from the functional gradient method perspective of the gradient layer"], ["BODY", "interestingly , the optimization procedure using the gradient layer naturally constructs the deep structure of the network"], ["CONCLUSION", "moreover , we demonstrate that this procedure can be regarded as a discretization method of the gradient flow that naturally reduces the objective function"], ["CONCLUSION", "finally , the method is tested using several numerical experiments , which show its fast convergence ."]], "topics": ["numerical analysis", "loss function"]}
{"title": "does a plane imitate a bird ? does computer vision have to follow biological paradigms ?", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we posit a new paradigm for image information processing"], ["INTRODUCTION", "for the last 25 years , this task was usually approached in the frame of treisman 's two-stage paradigm [ 1 ]"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the latter supposes an unsupervised , bottom-up directed process of preliminary information pieces gathering at the lower processing stages and a supervised , top-down directed process of information pieces binding and grouping at the higher stages"], ["INTRODUCTION", "it is acknowledged that these sub-processes interact and intervene between them in a tricky and a complicated manner"], ["BODY", "notwithstanding the prevalence of this paradigm in biological and computer vision , we nevertheless propose to replace it with a new one , which we would like to designate as a two-part paradigm"], ["BODY", "in it , information contained in an image is initially extracted in an independent top-down manner by one part of the system , and then it is examined and interpreted by another , separate system part"], ["BODY", "we argue that the new paradigm seems to be more plausible than its forerunner"], ["CONCLUSION", "we provide evidence from human attention vision studies and insights of kolmogorov 's complexity theory to support our arguments"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also provide some reasons in favor of separate image interpretation issues ."]], "topics": ["unsupervised learning", "computer vision"]}

{"title": "predicting human activities using stochastic grammar", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "this paper presents a novel method to predict future human activities from partially observed rgb-d videos"], ["BODY", "human activity prediction is generally difficult due to its non-markovian property and the rich context between human and environments"], ["BODY", "we use a stochastic grammar model to capture the compositional structure of events , integrating human actions , objects , and their affordances"], ["BODY", "we represent the event by a spatial-temporal and-or graph ( st-aog )"], ["BODY", "the st-aog is composed of a temporal stochastic grammar defined on sub-activities , and spatial graphs representing sub-activities that consist of human actions , objects , and their affordances"], ["BODY", "future sub-activities are predicted using the temporal grammar and earley parsing algorithm"], ["BODY", "the corresponding action , object , and affordance labels are then inferred accordingly"], ["CONCLUSION", "extensive experiments are conducted to show the effectiveness of our model on both semantic event parsing and future activity prediction ."]], "topics": ["parsing"]}

{"title": "overlapping and non-overlapping camera layouts for robot pose estimation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we study the use of overlapping and non-overlapping camera layouts in estimating the ego-motion of a moving robot"], ["BODY", "to estimate the location and orientation of the robot , we investigate using four cameras as non-overlapping individuals , and as two stereo pairs"], ["BODY", "the pros and cons of the two approaches are elucidated"], ["BODY", "the cameras work independently and can have larger field of view in the non-overlapping layout"], ["BODY", "however , a scale factor ambiguity should be dealt with"], ["BODY", "on the other hand , stereo systems provide more accuracy but require establishing feature correspondence with more computational demand"], ["BODY", "for both approaches , the extended kalman filter is used as a real-time recursive estimator"], ["CONCLUSION", "the approaches studied are verified with synthetic and real experiments alike ."]], "topics": ["synthetic data", "robot"]}
{"title": "learning deep structured active contours end-to-end", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the world is covered with millions of buildings , and precisely knowing each instance 's position and extents is vital to a multitude of applications"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recently , automated building footprint segmentation models have shown superior detection accuracy thanks to the usage of convolutional neural networks ( cnn )"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , even the latest evolutions struggle to precisely delineating borders , which often leads to geometric distortions and inadvertent fusion of adjacent building instances"], ["BODY", "we propose to overcome this issue by exploiting the distinct geometric properties of buildings"], ["BODY", "to this end , we present deep structured active contours ( dsac ) , a novel framework that integrates priors and constraints into the segmentation process , such as continuous boundaries , smooth edges , and sharp corners"], ["BODY", "to do so , dsac employs active contour models ( acm ) , a family of constraint- and prior-based polygonal models"], ["BODY", "we learn acm parameterizations per instance using a cnn , and show how to incorporate all components in a structured output model , making dsac trainable end-to-end"], ["CONCLUSION", "we evaluate dsac on three challenging building instance segmentation datasets , where it compares favorably against state-of-the-art"], ["CONCLUSION", "code will be made available ."]], "topics": ["end-to-end principle"]}
{"title": "representing verbs with rich contexts : an evaluation on verb similarity", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "several studies on sentence processing suggest that the mental lexicon keeps track of the mutual expectations between words"], ["INTRODUCTION", "current dsms , however , represent context words as separate features , thereby loosing important information for word expectations , such as word interrelations"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we present a dsm that addresses this issue by defining verb contexts as joint syntactic dependencies"], ["BODY", "we test our representation in a verb similarity task on two datasets , showing that joint contexts achieve performances comparable to single dependencies or even better"], ["CONCLUSION", "moreover , they are able to overcome the data sparsity problem of joint feature spaces , in spite of the limited size of our training corpus ."]], "topics": ["test set"]}
{"title": "fast amortized inference of neural activity from calcium imaging data with variational autoencoders", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "calcium imaging permits optical measurement of neural activity"], ["INTRODUCTION", "since intracellular calcium concentration is an indirect measurement of neural activity , computational tools are necessary to infer the true underlying spiking activity from fluorescence measurements"], ["INTRODUCTION", "bayesian model inversion can be used to solve this problem , but typically requires either computationally expensive mcmc sampling , or faster but approximate maximum-a-posteriori optimization"], ["BODY", "here , we introduce a flexible algorithmic framework for fast , efficient and accurate extraction of neural spikes from imaging data"], ["BODY", "using the framework of variational autoencoders , we propose to amortize inference by training a deep neural network to perform model inversion efficiently"], ["BODY", "the recognition network is trained to produce samples from the posterior distribution over spike trains"], ["BODY", "once trained , performing inference amounts to a fast single forward pass through the network , without the need for iterative optimization or sampling"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that amortization can be applied flexibly to a wide range of nonlinear generative models and significantly improves upon the state of the art in computation time , while achieving competitive accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "our framework is also able to represent posterior distributions over spike-trains"], ["CONCLUSION", "we demonstrate the generality of our method by proposing the first probabilistic approach for separating backpropagating action potentials from putative synaptic inputs in calcium imaging of dendritic spines ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "calculus of variations"]}
{"title": "deep extreme feature extraction : new mva method for searching particles in high energy physics", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this paper , we present deep extreme feature extraction ( defe ) , a new ensemble mva method for searching $ \\tau^ { + } \\tau^ { - } $ channel of higgs bosons in high energy physics"], ["BODY", "defe can be viewed as a deep ensemble learning scheme that trains a strongly diverse set of neural feature learners without explicitly encouraging diversity and penalizing correlations"], ["BODY", "this is achieved by adopting an implicit neural controller ( not involved in feedforward compuation ) that directly controls and distributes gradient flows from higher level deep prediction network"], ["BODY", "such model-independent controller results in that every single local feature learned are used in the feature-to-output mapping stage , avoiding the blind averaging of features"], ["BODY", "defe makes the ensembles 'deep ' in the sense that it allows deep post-process of these features that tries to learn to select and abstract the ensemble of neural feature learners"], ["BODY", "with the application of this model , a selection regions full of signal process can be obtained through the training of a miniature collision events set"], ["CONCLUSION", "in comparison of the classic deep neural network , defe shows a state-of-the-art performance : the error rate has decreased by about 37\\ % , the accuracy has broken through 90\\ % for the first time , along with the discovery significance has reached a standard deviation of 6.0 $ \\sigma $"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental data shows that , defe is able to train an ensemble of discriminative feature learners that boosts the overperformance of final prediction ."]], "topics": ["high- and low-level", "feature extraction"]}

{"title": "context matters : refining object detection in video with recurrent neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "given the vast amounts of video available online , and recent breakthroughs in object detection with static images , object detection in video offers a promising new frontier"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , motion blur and compression artifacts cause substantial frame-level variability , even in videos that appear smooth to the eye"], ["INTRODUCTION", "additionally , video datasets tend to have sparsely annotated frames"], ["BODY", "we present a new framework for improving object detection in videos that captures temporal context and encourages consistency of predictions"], ["BODY", "first , we train a pseudo-labeler , that is , a domain-adapted convolutional neural network for object detection"], ["BODY", "the pseudo-labeler is first trained individually on the subset of labeled frames , and then subsequently applied to all frames"], ["BODY", "then we train a recurrent neural network that takes as input sequences of pseudo-labeled frames and optimizes an objective that encourages both accuracy on the target frame and consistency across consecutive frames"], ["BODY", "the approach incorporates strong supervision of target frames , weak-supervision on context frames , and regularization via a smoothness penalty"], ["CONCLUSION", "our approach achieves mean average precision ( map ) of 68.73 , an improvement of 7.1 over the strongest image-based baselines for the youtube-video objects dataset"], ["CONCLUSION", "our experiments demonstrate that neighboring frames can provide valuable information , even absent labels ."]], "topics": ["object detection", "recurrent neural network"]}
{"title": "visda : the visual domain adaptation challenge", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present the 2017 visual domain adaptation ( visda ) dataset and challenge , a large-scale testbed for unsupervised domain adaptation across visual domains"], ["BODY", "unsupervised domain adaptation aims to solve the real-world problem of domain shift , where machine learning models trained on one domain must be transferred and adapted to a novel visual domain without additional supervision"], ["BODY", "the visda2017 challenge is focused on the simulation-to-reality shift and has two associated tasks : image classification and image segmentation"], ["BODY", "the goal in both tracks is to first train a model on simulated , synthetic data in the source domain and then adapt it to perform well on real image data in the unlabeled test domain"], ["CONCLUSION", "our dataset is the largest one to date for cross-domain object classification , with over 280k images across 12 categories in the combined training , validation and testing domains"], ["CONCLUSION", "the image segmentation dataset is also large-scale with over 30k images across 18 categories in the three domains"], ["CONCLUSION", "we compare visda to existing cross-domain adaptation datasets and provide a baseline performance analysis using various domain adaptation models that are currently popular in the field ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "image segmentation"]}
{"title": "learning uncertain convolutional features for accurate saliency detection", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "deep convolutional neural networks ( cnns ) have delivered superior performance in many computer vision tasks"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel deep fully convolutional network model for accurate salient object detection"], ["BODY", "the key contribution of this work is to learn deep uncertain convolutional features ( ucf ) , which encourage the robustness and accuracy of saliency detection"], ["BODY", "we achieve this via introducing a reformulated dropout ( r-dropout ) after specific convolutional layers to construct an uncertain ensemble of internal feature units"], ["BODY", "in addition , we propose an effective hybrid upsampling method to reduce the checkerboard artifacts of deconvolution operators in our decoder network"], ["BODY", "the proposed methods can also be applied to other deep convolutional networks"], ["CONCLUSION", "compared with existing saliency detection methods , the proposed ucf model is able to incorporate uncertainties for more accurate object boundary inference"], ["CONCLUSION", "extensive experiments demonstrate that our proposed saliency model performs favorably against state-of-the-art approaches"], ["CONCLUSION", "the uncertain feature learning mechanism as well as the upsampling method can significantly improve performance on other pixel-wise vision tasks ."]], "topics": ["feature learning", "object detection"]}
{"title": "iedc : an integrated approach for overlapping and non-overlapping community detection", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "community detection is a task of fundamental importance in social network analysis that can be used in a variety of knowledge-based domains"], ["INTRODUCTION", "while there exist many works on community detection based on connectivity structures , they suffer from either considering the overlapping or non-overlapping communities"], ["BODY", "in this work , we propose a novel approach for general community detection through an integrated framework to extract the overlapping and non-overlapping community structures without assuming prior structural connectivity on networks"], ["BODY", "our general framework is based on a primary node based criterion which consists of the internal association degree along with the external association degree"], ["BODY", "the evaluation of the proposed method is investigated through the extensive simulation experiments and several benchmark real network datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "the experimental results show that the proposed method outperforms the earlier state-of-the-art algorithms based on the well-known evaluation criteria ."]], "topics": ["interaction", "simulation"]}

{"title": "fast adaptation in generative models with generative matching networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "despite recent advances , the remaining bottlenecks in deep generative models are necessity of extensive training and difficulties with generalization from small number of training examples"], ["BODY", "we develop a new generative model called generative matching network which is inspired by the recently proposed matching networks for one-shot learning in discriminative tasks"], ["BODY", "by conditioning on the additional input dataset , our model can instantly learn new concepts that were not available in the training data but conform to a similar generative process"], ["BODY", "the proposed framework does not explicitly restrict diversity of the conditioning data and also does not require an extensive inference procedure for training or adaptation"], ["CONCLUSION", "our experiments on the omniglot dataset demonstrate that generative matching networks significantly improve predictive performance on the fly as more additional data is available and outperform existing state of the art conditional generative models ."]], "topics": ["generative model", "feature extraction"]}
{"title": "graph classification with 2d convolutional neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "graph learning is currently dominated by graph kernels , which , while powerful , suffer some significant limitations"], ["INTRODUCTION", "convolutional neural networks ( cnns ) offer a very appealing alternative , but processing graphs with cnns is not trivial"], ["INTRODUCTION", "to address this challenge , many sophisticated extensions of cnns have recently been introduced"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we reverse the problem : rather than proposing yet another graph cnn model , we introduce a novel way to represent graphs as multi-channel image-like structures that allows them to be handled by vanilla 2d cnns"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments reveal that our method is more accurate than state-of-the-art graph kernels and graph cnns on 4 out of 6 real-world datasets ( with and without continuous node attributes ) , and close elsewhere"], ["CONCLUSION", "our approach is also preferable to graph kernels in terms of time complexity"], ["CONCLUSION", "code and data are publicly available ."]], "topics": ["time complexity", "neural networks"]}

{"title": "convolutional image captioning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "image captioning is an important but challenging task , applicable to virtual assistants , editing tools , image indexing , and support of the disabled"], ["INTRODUCTION", "its challenges are due to the variability and ambiguity of possible image descriptions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "in recent years significant progress has been made in image captioning , using recurrent neural networks powered by long-short-term-memory ( lstm ) units"], ["INTRODUCTION", "despite mitigating the vanishing gradient problem , and despite their compelling ability to memorize dependencies , lstm units are complex and inherently sequential across time"], ["INTRODUCTION", "to address this issue , recent work has shown benefits of convolutional networks for machine translation and conditional image generation"], ["BODY", "inspired by their success , in this paper , we develop a convolutional image captioning technique"], ["BODY", "we demonstrate its efficacy on the challenging mscoco dataset and demonstrate performance on par with the baseline , while having a faster training time per number of parameters"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also perform a detailed analysis , providing compelling reasons in favor of convolutional language generation approaches ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "recurrent neural network"]}
{"title": "possibilistic pertinence feedback and semantic networks for goal 's extraction", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "pertinence feedback is a technique that enables a user to interactively express his information requirement by modifying his original query formulation with further information"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this information is provided by explicitly confirming the pertinent of some indicating objects and/or goals extracted by the system"], ["INTRODUCTION", "obviously the user can not mark objects and/or goals as pertinent until some are extracted , so the first search has to be initiated by a query and the initial query specification has to be good enough to pick out some pertinent objects and/or goals from the semantic network"], ["BODY", "in this paper we present a short survey of fuzzy and semantic approaches to knowledge extraction"], ["BODY", "the goal of such approaches is to define flexible knowledge extraction systems able to deal with the inherent vagueness and uncertainty of the extraction process"], ["BODY", "it has long been recognised that interactivity improves the effectiveness of knowledge extraction systems"], ["BODY", "novice user 's queries are the most natural and interactive medium of communication and recent progress in recognition is making it possible to build systems that interact with the user"], ["BODY", "however , given the typical novice user 's queries submitted to knowledge extraction systems , it is easy to imagine that the effects of goal recognition errors in novice user 's queries must be severely destructive on the system 's effectiveness"], ["CONCLUSION", "the experimental work reported in this paper shows that the use of possibility theory in classical knowledge extraction techniques for novice user 's query processing is more robust than the use of the probability theory"], ["CONCLUSION", "moreover , both possibilistic and probabilistic pertinence feedback can be effectively employed to improve the effectiveness of novice user 's query processing ."]], "topics": ["relevance", "database"]}
{"title": "fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "convolutional networks are powerful visual models that yield hierarchies of features"], ["BODY", "we show that convolutional networks by themselves , trained end-to-end , pixels-to-pixels , improve on the previous best result in semantic segmentation"], ["BODY", "our key insight is to build `` fully convolutional '' networks that take input of arbitrary size and produce correspondingly-sized output with efficient inference and learning"], ["BODY", "we define and detail the space of fully convolutional networks , explain their application to spatially dense prediction tasks , and draw connections to prior models"], ["BODY", "we adapt contemporary classification networks ( alexnet , the vgg net , and googlenet ) into fully convolutional networks and transfer their learned representations by fine-tuning to the segmentation task"], ["BODY", "we then define a skip architecture that combines semantic information from a deep , coarse layer with appearance information from a shallow , fine layer to produce accurate and detailed segmentations"], ["CONCLUSION", "our fully convolutional network achieves improved segmentation of pascal voc ( 30 % relative improvement to 67.2 % mean iu on 2012 ) , nyudv2 , sift flow , and pascal-context , while inference takes one tenth of a second for a typical image ."]], "topics": ["end-to-end principle", "pixel"]}
{"title": "regularized maximum likelihood for intrinsic dimension estimation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we propose a new method for estimating the intrinsic dimension of a dataset by applying the principle of regularized maximum likelihood to the distances between close neighbors"], ["BODY", "we propose a regularization scheme which is motivated by divergence minimization principles"], ["BODY", "we derive the estimator by a poisson process approximation , argue about its convergence properties and apply it to a number of simulated and real datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also show it has the best overall performance compared with two other intrinsic dimension estimators ."]], "topics": ["matrix regularization", "simulation"]}
{"title": "anchoring and agreement in syntactic annotations", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present a study on two key characteristics of human syntactic annotations : anchoring and agreement"], ["BODY", "anchoring is a well known cognitive bias in human decision making , where judgments are drawn towards pre-existing values"], ["BODY", "we study the influence of anchoring on a standard approach to creation of syntactic resources where syntactic annotations are obtained via human editing of tagger and parser output"], ["BODY", "our experiments demonstrate a clear anchoring effect and reveal unwanted consequences , including overestimation of parsing performance and lower quality of annotations in comparison with human-based annotations"], ["CONCLUSION", "using sentences from the penn treebank wsj , we also report systematically obtained inter-annotator agreement estimates for english dependency parsing"], ["CONCLUSION", "our agreement results control for parser bias , and are consequential in that they are on par with state of the art parsing performance for english newswire"], ["CONCLUSION", "we discuss the impact of our findings on strategies for future annotation efforts and parser evaluations ."]], "topics": ["value ( ethics )", "parsing"]}
{"title": "a mutually-dependent hadamard kernel for modelling latent variable couplings", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a novel kernel that models input-dependent couplings across multiple latent processes"], ["BODY", "the pairwise joint kernel measures covariance along inputs and across different latent signals in a mutually-dependent fashion"], ["BODY", "a latent correlation gaussian process ( lcgp ) model combines these non-stationary latent components into multiple outputs by an input-dependent mixing matrix"], ["BODY", "probit classification and support for multiple observation sets are derived by variational bayesian inference"], ["CONCLUSION", "results on several datasets indicate that the lcgp model can recover the correlations between latent signals while simultaneously achieving state-of-the-art performance"], ["CONCLUSION", "we highlight the latent covariances with an eeg classification dataset where latent brain processes and their couplings simultaneously emerge from the model ."]], "topics": ["kernel ( operating system )"]}
{"title": "fair clustering through fairlets", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we study the question of fair clustering under the { \\em disparate impact } doctrine , where each protected class must have approximately equal representation in every cluster"], ["BODY", "we formulate the fair clustering problem under both the $ k $ -center and the $ k $ -median objectives , and show that even with two protected classes the problem is challenging , as the optimum solution can violate common conventions -- -for instance a point may no longer be assigned to its nearest cluster center ! en route we introduce the concept of fairlets , which are minimal sets that satisfy fair representation while approximately preserving the clustering objective"], ["BODY", "we show that any fair clustering problem can be decomposed into first finding good fairlets , and then using existing machinery for traditional clustering algorithms"], ["BODY", "while finding good fairlets can be np-hard , we proceed to obtain efficient approximation algorithms based on minimum cost flow"], ["CONCLUSION", "we empirically quantify the value of fair clustering on real-world datasets with sensitive attributes ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "approximation algorithm"]}
{"title": "mono-camera 3d multi-object tracking using deep learning detections and pmbm filtering", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "monocular cameras are one of the most commonly used sensors in the automotive industry for autonomous vehicles"], ["INTRODUCTION", "one major drawback using a monocular camera is that it only makes observations in the two dimensional image plane and can not directly measure the distance to objects"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we aim at filling this gap by developing a multi-object tracking algorithm that takes an image as input and produces trajectories of detected objects in a world coordinate system"], ["BODY", "we solve this by using a deep neural network trained to detect and estimate the distance to objects from a single input image"], ["BODY", "the detections from a sequence of images are fed in to a state-of-the art poisson multi-bernoulli mixture tracking filter"], ["BODY", "the combination of the learned detector and the pmbm filter results in an algorithm that achieves 3d tracking using only mono-camera images as input"], ["CONCLUSION", "the performance of the algorithm is evaluated both in 3d world coordinates , and 2d image coordinates , using the publicly available kitti object tracking dataset"], ["CONCLUSION", "the algorithm shows the ability to accurately track objects , correctly handle data associations , even when there is a big overlap of the objects in the image , and is one of the top performing algorithms on the kitti object tracking benchmark"], ["CONCLUSION", "furthermore , the algorithm is efficient , running on average close to 20 frames per second ."]], "topics": ["sensor", "autonomous car"]}
{"title": "an improved video analysis using context based extension of lsh", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "locality sensitive hashing ( lsh ) based algorithms have already shown their promise in finding approximate nearest neighbors in high dimen- sional data space"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , there are certain scenarios , as in sequential data , where the proximity of a pair of points can not be captured without considering their surroundings or context"], ["INTRODUCTION", "in videos , as for example , a particular frame is meaningful only when it is seen in the context of its preceding and following frames"], ["INTRODUCTION", "lsh has no mechanism to handle the con- texts of the data points"], ["BODY", "in this article , a novel scheme of context based locality sensitive hashing ( conlsh ) has been introduced , in which points are hashed together not only based on their closeness , but also because of similar context"], ["BODY", "the contribution made in this article is three fold"], ["CONCLUSION", "first , conlsh is integrated with a recently proposed fast optimal sequence alignment algorithm ( fogsaa ) using a layered approach"], ["CONCLUSION", "the resultant method is applied to video retrieval for extracting similar sequences"], ["CONCLUSION", "the pro- posed algorithm yields more than 80 % accuracy on an average in different datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "it has been found to save 36.3 % of the total time , consumed by the exhaustive search"], ["CONCLUSION", "conlsh reduces the search space to approximately 42 % of the entire dataset , when compared with an exhaustive search by the aforementioned fogsaa , bag of words method and the standard lsh implementations"], ["CONCLUSION", "secondly , the effectiveness of conlsh is demon- strated in action recognition of the video clips , which yields an average gain of 12.83 % in terms of classification accuracy over the state of the art methods using stip descriptors"], ["CONCLUSION", "the last but of great significance is that this article provides a way of automatically annotating long and composite real life videos"], ["CONCLUSION", "the source code of conlsh is made available at http : //www.isical.ac.in/~bioinfo_miu/conlsh/conlsh.html"]], "topics": ["approximation algorithm"]}

{"title": "c-arm tomographic imaging technique for nephrolithiasis and detection of kidney stones", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this paper , we investigated a c-arm tomographic technique as a new three dimensional ( 3d ) kidney imaging method for nephrolithiasis and kidney stone detection over view angle less than 180o"], ["BODY", "our c-arm tomographic technique provides a series of two dimensional ( 2d ) images with a single scan over 40o view angle"], ["BODY", "experimental studies were performed with a kidney phantom that was formed from a pig kidney with two embedded kidney stones"], ["BODY", "different reconstruction methods were developed for c-arm tomographic technique to generate 3d kidney information including : point by point back projection ( bp ) , filtered back projection ( fbp ) , simultaneous algebraic reconstruction technique ( sart ) and maximum likelihood expectation maximization ( mlem )"], ["BODY", "computer simulation study was also done with simulated 3d spherical object to evaluate the reconstruction results"], ["CONCLUSION", "preliminary results demonstrated the capability of our c-arm tomographic technique to generate 3d kidney information for kidney stone detection with low exposure of radiation"], ["CONCLUSION", "the kidney stones are visible on reconstructed planes with identifiable shapes and sizes ."]], "topics": ["simulation"]}
{"title": "gauss quadrature for matrix inverse forms with applications", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present a framework for accelerating a spectrum of machine learning algorithms that require computation of bilinear inverse forms $ u^\\top a^ { -1 } u $ , where $ a $ is a positive definite matrix and $ u $ a given vector"], ["BODY", "our framework is built on gauss-type quadrature and easily scales to large , sparse matrices"], ["BODY", "further , it allows retrospective computation of lower and upper bounds on $ u^\\top a^ { -1 } u $ , which in turn accelerates several algorithms"], ["BODY", "we prove that these bounds tighten iteratively and converge at a linear ( geometric ) rate"], ["BODY", "to our knowledge , ours is the first work to demonstrate these key properties of gauss-type quadrature , which is a classical and deeply studied topic"], ["CONCLUSION", "we illustrate empirical consequences of our results by using quadrature to accelerate machine learning tasks involving determinantal point processes and submodular optimization , and observe tremendous speedups in several instances ."]], "topics": ["nonlinear system", "polynomial"]}
