{"title": "image segmentation by discounted cumulative ranking on maximal cliques", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we propose a mid-level image segmentation framework that combines multiple figure-ground hypothesis ( fg ) constrained at different locations and scales , into interpretations that tile the entire image"], ["BODY", "the problem is cast as optimization over sets of maximal cliques sampled from the graph connecting non-overlapping , putative figure-ground segment hypotheses"], ["BODY", "potential functions over cliques combine unary gestalt-based figure quality scores and pairwise compatibilities among spatially neighboring segments , constrained by t-junctions and the boundary interface statistics resulting from projections of real 3d scenes"], ["BODY", "learning the model parameters is formulated as rank optimization , alternating between sampling image tilings and optimizing their potential function parameters"], ["CONCLUSION", "state of the art results are reported on both the berkeley and the voc2009 segmentation dataset , where a 28 % improvement was achieved ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "image segmentation"]}
{"title": "geometric feature-based facial expression recognition in image sequences using multi-class adaboost and support vector machines", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "facial expressions are widely used in the behavioral interpretation of emotions , cognitive science , and social interactions"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we present a novel method for fully automatic facial expression recognition in facial image sequences"], ["BODY", "as the facial expression evolves over time facial landmarks are automatically tracked in consecutive video frames , using displacements based on elastic bunch graph matching displacement estimation"], ["BODY", "feature vectors from individual landmarks , as well as pairs of landmarks tracking results are extracted , and normalized , with respect to the first frame in the sequence"], ["BODY", "the prototypical expression sequence for each class of facial expression is formed , by taking the median of the landmark tracking results from the training facial expression sequences"], ["BODY", "multi-class adaboost with dynamic time warping similarity distance between the feature vector of input facial expression and prototypical facial expression , is used as a weak classifier to select the subset of discriminative feature vectors"], ["CONCLUSION", "finally , two methods for facial expression recognition are presented , either by using multi-class adaboost with dynamic time warping , or by using support vector machine on the boosted feature vectors"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results on the cohn-kanade ( ck+ ) facial expression database show a recognition accuracy of 95.17 % and 97.35 % using multi-class adaboost and support vector machines , respectively ."]], "topics": ["feature vector", "support vector machine"]}
{"title": "accelerating eulerian fluid simulation with convolutional networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "efficient simulation of the navier-stokes equations for fluid flow is a long standing problem in applied mathematics , for which state-of-the-art methods require large compute resources"], ["BODY", "in this work , we propose a data-driven approach that leverages the approximation power of deep-learning with the precision of standard solvers to obtain fast and highly realistic simulations"], ["BODY", "our method solves the incompressible euler equations using the standard operator splitting method , in which a large sparse linear system with many free parameters must be solved"], ["BODY", "we use a convolutional network with a highly tailored architecture , trained using a novel unsupervised learning framework to solve the linear system"], ["CONCLUSION", "we present real-time 2d and 3d simulations that outperform recently proposed data-driven methods ; the obtained results are realistic and show good generalization properties ."]], "topics": ["supervised learning", "computational complexity theory"]}

{"title": "a simple squared-error reformulation for ordinal classification", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this paper , we explore ordinal classification ( in the context of deep neural networks ) through a simple modification of the squared error loss which not only allows it to not only be sensitive to class ordering , but also allows the possibility of having a discrete probability distribution over the classes"], ["BODY", "our formulation is based on the use of a softmax hidden layer , which has received relatively little attention in the literature"], ["BODY", "we empirically evaluate its performance on the kaggle diabetic retinopathy dataset , an ordinal and high-resolution dataset and show that it outperforms all of the baselines employed ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )"]}
{"title": "landmark-based plan recognition", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "recognition of goals and plans using incomplete evidence from action execution can be done efficiently by using planning techniques"], ["INTRODUCTION", "in many applications it is important to recognize goals and plans not only accurately , but also quickly"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we develop a heuristic approach for recognizing plans based on planning techniques that rely on ordering constraints to filter candidate goals from observations"], ["BODY", "these ordering constraints are called landmarks in the planning literature , which are facts or actions that can not be avoided to achieve a goal"], ["BODY", "we show the applicability of planning landmarks in two settings : first , we use it directly to develop a heuristic-based plan recognition approach ; second , we refine an existing planning-based plan recognition approach by pre-filtering its candidate goals"], ["CONCLUSION", "our empirical evaluation shows that our approach is not only substantially more accurate than the state-of-the-art in all available datasets , it is also an order of magnitude faster ."]], "topics": ["heuristic"]}
{"title": "end-to-end flow correlation tracking with spatial-temporal attention", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "discriminative correlation filters ( dcf ) with deep convolutional features have achieved favorable performance in recent tracking benchmarks"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , most of existing dcf trackers only consider appearance features of current frame , and hardly benefit from motion and inter-frame information"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the lack of temporal information degrades the tracking performance during challenges such as partial occlusion and deformation"], ["BODY", "in this work , we focus on making use of the rich flow information in consecutive frames to improve the feature representation and the tracking accuracy"], ["BODY", "firstly , individual components , including optical flow estimation , feature extraction , aggregation and correlation filter tracking are formulated as special layers in network"], ["BODY", "to the best of our knowledge , this is the first work to jointly train flow and tracking task in a deep learning framework"], ["BODY", "then the historical feature maps at predefined intervals are warped and aggregated with current ones by the guiding of flow"], ["BODY", "for adaptive aggregation , we propose a novel spatial-temporal attention mechanism"], ["CONCLUSION", "extensive experiments are performed on four challenging tracking datasets : otb2013 , otb2015 , vot2015 and vot2016 , and the proposed method achieves superior results on these benchmarks ."]], "topics": ["feature extraction", "map"]}
{"title": "sampling for inference in probabilistic models with fast bayesian quadrature", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we propose a novel sampling framework for inference in probabilistic models : an active learning approach that converges more quickly ( in wall-clock time ) than markov chain monte carlo ( mcmc ) benchmarks"], ["BODY", "the central challenge in probabilistic inference is numerical integration , to average over ensembles of models or unknown ( hyper- ) parameters ( for example to compute the marginal likelihood or a partition function )"], ["BODY", "mcmc has provided approaches to numerical integration that deliver state-of-the-art inference , but can suffer from sample inefficiency and poor convergence diagnostics"], ["BODY", "bayesian quadrature techniques offer a model-based solution to such problems , but their uptake has been hindered by prohibitive computation costs"], ["BODY", "we introduce a warped model for probabilistic integrands ( likelihoods ) that are known to be non-negative , permitting a cheap active learning scheme to optimally select sample locations"], ["CONCLUSION", "our algorithm is demonstrated to offer faster convergence ( in seconds ) relative to simple monte carlo and annealed importance sampling on both synthetic and real-world examples ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "numerical analysis"]}
{"title": "best-effort inductive logic programming via fine-grained cost-based hypothesis generation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we describe the inspire system which participated in the first competition on inductive logic programming ( ilp )"], ["BODY", "inspire is based on answer set programming ( asp )"], ["BODY", "the distinguishing feature of inspire is an asp encoding for hypothesis space generation : given a set of facts representing the mode bias , and a set of cost configuration parameters , each answer set of this encoding represents a single rule that is considered for finding a hypothesis that entails the given examples"], ["BODY", "compared with state-of-the-art methods that use the length of the rule body as a metric for rule complexity , our approach permits a much more fine-grained specification of the shape of hypothesis candidate rules"], ["BODY", "the inspire system iteratively increases the rule cost limit and thereby increases the search space until it finds a suitable hypothesis"], ["BODY", "the system searches for a hypothesis that entails a single example at a time , utilizing an asp encoding derived from the encoding used in xhail"], ["CONCLUSION", "we perform experiments with the development and test set of the ilp competition"], ["CONCLUSION", "for comparison we also adapted the ilasp system to process competition instances"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results show that the cost parameters for the hypothesis search space are an important factor for finding hypotheses to competition instances within tight resource bounds ."]], "topics": ["test set"]}
{"title": "a classification-based perspective on gan distributions", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "a fundamental , and still largely unanswered , question in the context of generative adversarial networks ( gans ) is whether gans are actually able to capture the key characteristics of the datasets they are trained on"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the current approaches to examining this issue require significant human supervision , such as visual inspection of sampled images , and often offer only fairly limited scalability"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose new techniques that employ a classification-based perspective to evaluate synthetic gan distributions and their capability to accurately reflect the essential properties of the training data"], ["BODY", "these techniques require only minimal human supervision and can easily be scaled and adapted to evaluate a variety of state-of-the-art gans on large , popular datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "our analysis indicates that gans have significant problems in reproducing the more distributional properties of the training dataset"], ["CONCLUSION", "in particular , when seen through the lens of classification , the diversity of gan data is orders of magnitude less than that of the original data ."]], "topics": ["test set", "synthetic data"]}
{"title": "trainable methods for surface natural language generation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present three systems for surface natural language generation that are trainable from annotated corpora"], ["BODY", "the first two systems , called nlg1 and nlg2 , require a corpus marked only with domain-specific semantic attributes , while the last system , called nlg3 , requires a corpus marked with both semantic attributes and syntactic dependency information"], ["BODY", "all systems attempt to produce a grammatical natural language phrase from a domain-specific semantic representation"], ["BODY", "nlg1 serves a baseline system and uses phrase frequencies to generate a whole phrase in one step , while nlg2 and nlg3 use maximum entropy probability models to individually generate each word in the phrase"], ["CONCLUSION", "the systems nlg2 and nlg3 learn to determine both the word choice and the word order of the phrase"], ["CONCLUSION", "we present experiments in which we generate phrases to describe flights in the air travel domain ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "natural language"]}
{"title": "learning hand-eye coordination for robotic grasping with deep learning and large-scale data collection", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we describe a learning-based approach to hand-eye coordination for robotic grasping from monocular images"], ["BODY", "to learn hand-eye coordination for grasping , we trained a large convolutional neural network to predict the probability that task-space motion of the gripper will result in successful grasps , using only monocular camera images and independently of camera calibration or the current robot pose"], ["BODY", "this requires the network to observe the spatial relationship between the gripper and objects in the scene , thus learning hand-eye coordination"], ["BODY", "we then use this network to servo the gripper in real time to achieve successful grasps"], ["CONCLUSION", "to train our network , we collected over 800,000 grasp attempts over the course of two months , using between 6 and 14 robotic manipulators at any given time , with differences in camera placement and hardware"], ["CONCLUSION", "our experimental evaluation demonstrates that our method achieves effective real-time control , can successfully grasp novel objects , and corrects mistakes by continuous servoing ."]], "topics": ["robot"]}
{"title": "recognition of feature curves on 3d shapes using an algebraic approach to hough transforms", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "feature curves are largely adopted to highlight shape features , such as sharp lines , or to divide surfaces into meaningful segments , like convex or concave regions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "extracting these curves is not sufficient to convey prominent and meaningful information about a shape"], ["BODY", "we have first to separate the curves belonging to features from those caused by noise and then to select the lines , which describe non-trivial portions of a surface"], ["BODY", "the automatic detection of such features is crucial for the identification and/or annotation of relevant parts of a given shape"], ["BODY", "to do this , the hough transform ( ht ) is a feature extraction technique widely used in image analysis , computer vision and digital image processing , while , for 3d shapes , the extraction of salient feature curves is still an open problem"], ["BODY", "thanks to algebraic geometry concepts , the ht technique has been recently extended to include a vast class of algebraic curves , thus proving to be a competitive tool for yielding an explicit representation of the diverse feature lines equations"], ["BODY", "in the paper , for the first time we apply this novel extension of the ht technique to the realm of 3d shapes in order to identify and localize semantic features like patterns , decorations or anatomical details on 3d objects ( both complete and fragments ) , even in the case of features partially damaged or incomplete"], ["BODY", "the method recognizes various features , possibly compound , and it selects the most suitable feature profiles among families of algebraic curves ."]], "topics": ["image processing", "feature extraction"]}
{"title": "object detection in videos with tubelet proposal networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "object detection in videos has drawn increasing attention recently with the introduction of the large-scale imagenet vid dataset"], ["INTRODUCTION", "different from object detection in static images , temporal information in videos is vital for object detection"], ["INTRODUCTION", "to fully utilize temporal information , state-of-the-art methods are based on spatiotemporal tubelets , which are essentially sequences of associated bounding boxes across time"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , the existing methods have major limitations in generating tubelets in terms of quality and efficiency"], ["INTRODUCTION", "motion-based methods are able to obtain dense tubelets efficiently , but the lengths are generally only several frames , which is not optimal for incorporating long-term temporal information"], ["INTRODUCTION", "appearance-based methods , usually involving generic object tracking , could generate long tubelets , but are usually computationally expensive"], ["BODY", "in this work , we propose a framework for object detection in videos , which consists of a novel tubelet proposal network to efficiently generate spatiotemporal proposals , and a long short-term memory ( lstm ) network that incorporates temporal information from tubelet proposals for achieving high object detection accuracy in videos"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments on the large-scale imagenet vid dataset demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework for object detection in videos ."]], "topics": ["object detection"]}
{"title": "the goldilocks principle : reading children 's books with explicit memory representations", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a new test of how well language models capture meaning in children 's books"], ["BODY", "unlike standard language modelling benchmarks , it distinguishes the task of predicting syntactic function words from that of predicting lower-frequency words , which carry greater semantic content"], ["BODY", "we compare a range of state-of-the-art models , each with a different way of encoding what has been previously read"], ["BODY", "we show that models which store explicit representations of long-term contexts outperform state-of-the-art neural language models at predicting semantic content words , although this advantage is not observed for syntactic function words"], ["BODY", "interestingly , we find that the amount of text encoded in a single memory representation is highly influential to the performance : there is a sweet-spot , not too big and not too small , between single words and full sentences that allows the most meaningful information in a text to be effectively retained and recalled"], ["BODY", "further , the attention over such window-based memories can be trained effectively through self-supervision"], ["CONCLUSION", "we then assess the generality of this principle by applying it to the cnn qa benchmark , which involves identifying named entities in paraphrased summaries of news articles , and achieve state-of-the-art performance ."]], "topics": ["entity"]}

{"title": "adaptive quantization for deep neural network", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in recent years deep neural networks ( dnns ) have been rapidly developed in various applications , together with increasingly complex architectures"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the performance gain of these dnns generally comes with high computational costs and large memory consumption , which may not be affordable for mobile platforms"], ["INTRODUCTION", "deep model quantization can be used for reducing the computation and memory costs of dnns , and deploying complex dnns on mobile equipment"], ["BODY", "in this work , we propose an optimization framework for deep model quantization"], ["BODY", "first , we propose a measurement to estimate the effect of parameter quantization errors in individual layers on the overall model prediction accuracy"], ["BODY", "then , we propose an optimization process based on this measurement for finding optimal quantization bit-width for each layer"], ["BODY", "this is the first work that theoretically analyse the relationship between parameter quantization errors of individual layers and model accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "our new quantization algorithm outperforms previous quantization optimization methods , and achieves 20-40 % higher compression rate compared to equal bit-width quantization at the same model prediction accuracy ."]], "topics": ["mathematical optimization", "natural language processing"]}
{"title": "information-theoretic model identification and policy search using physics engines with application to robotic manipulation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we consider the problem of a robot learning the mechanical properties of objects through physical interaction with the object , and introduce a practical , data-efficient approach for identifying the motion models of these objects"], ["BODY", "the proposed method utilizes a physics engine , where the robot seeks to identify the inertial and friction parameters of the object by simulating its motion under different values of the parameters and identifying those that result in a simulation which matches the observed real motions"], ["BODY", "the problem is solved in a bayesian optimization framework"], ["BODY", "the same framework is used for both identifying the model of an object online and searching for a policy that would minimize a given cost function according to the identified model"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results both in simulation and using a real robot indicate that the proposed method outperforms state-of-the-art model-free reinforcement learning approaches ."]], "topics": ["value ( ethics )", "reinforcement learning"]}
{"title": "long-term forecasting using tensor-train rnns", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present tensor-train rnn ( tt-rnn ) , a novel family of neural sequence architectures for multivariate forecasting in environments with nonlinear dynamics"], ["BODY", "long-term forecasting in such systems is highly challenging , since there exist long-term temporal dependencies , higher-order correlations and sensitivity to error propagation"], ["BODY", "our proposed tensor recurrent architecture addresses these issues by learning the nonlinear dynamics directly using higher order moments and high-order state transition functions"], ["BODY", "furthermore , we decompose the higher-order structure using the tensor-train ( tt ) decomposition to reduce the number of parameters while preserving the model performance"], ["CONCLUSION", "we theoretically establish the approximation properties of tensor-train rnns for general sequence inputs , and such guarantees are not available for usual rnns"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also demonstrate significant long-term prediction improvements over general rnn and lstm architectures on a range of simulated environments with nonlinear dynamics , as well on real-world climate and traffic data ."]], "topics": ["nonlinear system", "simulation"]}
{"title": "finding numerical solutions of diophantine equations using ant colony optimization", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the paper attempts to find numerical solutions of diophantine equations , a challenging problem as there are no general methods to find solutions of such equations"], ["BODY", "it uses the metaphor of foraging habits of real ants"], ["BODY", "the ant colony optimization based procedure starts with randomly assigned locations to a fixed number of artificial ants"], ["BODY", "depending upon the quality of these positions , ants deposit pheromone at the nodes"], ["BODY", "a successor node is selected from the topological neighborhood of each of the nodes based on this stochastic pheromone deposit"], ["BODY", "if an ant bumps into an already encountered node , the pheromone is updated correspondingly"], ["BODY", "a suitably defined pheromone evaporation strategy guarantees that premature convergence does not take place"], ["CONCLUSION", "the experimental results , which compares with those of other machine intelligence techniques , validate the effectiveness of the proposed method ."]], "topics": ["numerical analysis", "artificial intelligence"]}
{"title": "large-scale 3d scene classification with multi-view volumetric cnn", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a method to classify imagery using a convo- lutional neural network ( cnn ) on multi-view image pro- jections"], ["BODY", "the power of our method comes from using pro- jections of multiple images at multiple depth planes near the reconstructed surface"], ["BODY", "this enables classification of categories whose salient aspect is appearance change un- der different viewpoints , such as water , trees , and other materials with complex reflection/light response proper- ties"], ["BODY", "our method does not require boundary labelling in images and works on pixel-level classification with a small ( few pixels ) context , which simplifies the cre- ation of a training set"], ["CONCLUSION", "we demonstrate this application on large-scale aerial imagery collections , and extend the per-pixel classification to robustly create a consistent 2d classification which can be used to fill the gaps in non- reconstructible water regions"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also apply our method to classify tree regions"], ["CONCLUSION", "in both cases , the training data can quickly be generated using a small number of manually- created polygons on a map"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that even with a very simple and standard network our cnn outperforms the state-of-the-art image classification , the inception-v3 model retrained from a large collection of aerial images ."]], "topics": ["test set", "computer vision"]}
{"title": "discriminatively trained latent ordinal model for video classification", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we study the problem of video classification for facial analysis and human action recognition"], ["BODY", "we propose a novel weakly supervised learning method that models the video as a sequence of automatically mined , discriminative sub-events ( eg"], ["BODY", "onset and offset phase for `` smile '' , running and jumping for `` highjump '' )"], ["BODY", "the proposed model is inspired by the recent works on multiple instance learning and latent svm/hcrf -- it extends such frameworks to model the ordinal aspect in the videos , approximately"], ["CONCLUSION", "we obtain consistent improvements over relevant competitive baselines on four challenging and publicly available video based facial analysis datasets for prediction of expression , clinical pain and intent in dyadic conversations and on three challenging human action datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also validate the method with qualitative results and show that they largely support the intuitions behind the method ."]], "topics": ["supervised learning", "support vector machine"]}
{"title": "automatically redundant features removal for unsupervised feature selection via sparse feature graph", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the redundant features existing in high dimensional datasets always affect the performance of learning and mining algorithms"], ["INTRODUCTION", "how to detect and remove them is an important research topic in machine learning and data mining research"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a graph based approach to find and remove those redundant features automatically for high dimensional data"], ["BODY", "based on the sparse learning based unsupervised feature selection framework , sparse feature graph ( sfg ) is introduced not only to model the redundancy between two features , but also to disclose the group redundancy between two groups of features"], ["BODY", "with sfg , we can divide the whole features into different groups , and improve the intrinsic structure of data by removing detected redundant features"], ["BODY", "with accurate data structure , quality indicator vectors can be obtained to improve the learning performance of existing unsupervised feature selection algorithms such as multi-cluster feature selection ( mcfs )"], ["CONCLUSION", "our experimental results on benchmark datasets show that the proposed sfg and feature redundancy remove algorithm can improve the performance of unsupervised feature selection algorithms consistently ."]], "topics": ["data mining", "sparse matrix"]}
{"title": "pdnet : prior-model guided depth-enhanced network for salient object detection", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "fully convolutional neural networks ( fcns ) have shown outstanding performance in many computer vision tasks including salient object detection"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , there still remains two issues needed to be addressed in deep learning based saliency detection"], ["INTRODUCTION", "one is the lack of tremendous amount of annotated data to train a network"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the other is the lack of robustness for extracting salient objects in images containing complex scenes"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we present a new architecture $ - $ pdnet , a robust prior-model guided depth-enhanced network for rgb-d salient object detection"], ["BODY", "in contrast to existing works , in which rgb-d values of image pixels are fed directly to a network , the proposed architecture is composed of a master network for processing rgb values , and a sub-network making full use of depth cues and incorporate depth-based features into the master network"], ["BODY", "to overcome the limited size of the labeled rgb-d dataset for training , we employ a large conventional rgb dataset to pre-train the master network , which proves to contribute largely to the final accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "extensive evaluations over five benchmark datasets demonstrate that our proposed method performs favorably against the state-of-the-art approaches ."]], "topics": ["object detection", "computer vision"]}
{"title": "modeling relation paths for representation learning of knowledge bases", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "representation learning of knowledge bases ( kbs ) aims to embed both entities and relations into a low-dimensional space"], ["INTRODUCTION", "most existing methods only consider direct relations in representation learning"], ["BODY", "we argue that multiple-step relation paths also contain rich inference patterns between entities , and propose a path-based representation learning model"], ["BODY", "this model considers relation paths as translations between entities for representation learning , and addresses two key challenges : ( 1 ) since not all relation paths are reliable , we design a path-constraint resource allocation algorithm to measure the reliability of relation paths"], ["BODY", "( 2 ) we represent relation paths via semantic composition of relation embeddings"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results on real-world datasets show that , as compared with baselines , our model achieves significant and consistent improvements on knowledge base completion and relation extraction from text ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "feature learning"]}

{"title": "autoprognosis : automated clinical prognostic modeling via bayesian optimization with structured kernel learning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "clinical prognostic models derived from largescale healthcare data can inform critical diagnostic and therapeutic decisions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "to enable off-theshelf usage of machine learning ( ml ) in prognostic research , we developed autoprognosis : a system for automating the design of predictive modeling pipelines tailored for clinical prognosis"], ["BODY", "autoprognosis optimizes ensembles of pipeline configurations efficiently using a novel batched bayesian optimization ( bo ) algorithm that learns a low-dimensional decomposition of the pipelines high-dimensional hyperparameter space in concurrence with the bo procedure"], ["BODY", "this is achieved by modeling the pipelines performances as a black-box function with a gaussian process prior , and modeling the similarities between the pipelines baseline algorithms via a sparse additive kernel with a dirichlet prior"], ["BODY", "meta-learning is used to warmstart bo with external data from similar patient cohorts by calibrating the priors using an algorithm that mimics the empirical bayes method"], ["BODY", "the system automatically explains its predictions by presenting the clinicians with logical association rules that link patients features to predicted risk strata"], ["CONCLUSION", "we demonstrate the utility of autoprognosis using 10 major patient cohorts representing various aspects of cardiovascular patient care ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "kernel ( operating system )"]}
{"title": "sparse partially linear additive models", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the generalized partially linear additive model ( gplam ) is a flexible and interpretable approach to building predictive models"], ["BODY", "it combines features in an additive manner , allowing each to have either a linear or nonlinear effect on the response"], ["BODY", "however , the choice of which features to treat as linear or nonlinear is typically assumed known"], ["BODY", "thus , to make a gplam a viable approach in situations in which little is known $ a~priori $ about the features , one must overcome two primary model selection challenges : deciding which features to include in the model and determining which of these features to treat nonlinearly"], ["BODY", "we introduce the sparse partially linear additive model ( splam ) , which combines model fitting and $ both $ of these model selection challenges into a single convex optimization problem"], ["BODY", "splam provides a bridge between the lasso and sparse additive models"], ["BODY", "through a statistical oracle inequality and thorough simulation , we demonstrate that splam can outperform other methods across a broad spectrum of statistical regimes , including the high-dimensional ( $ p\\gg n $ ) setting"], ["CONCLUSION", "we develop efficient algorithms that are applied to real data sets with half a million samples and over 45,000 features with excellent predictive performance ."]], "topics": ["optimization problem", "nonlinear system"]}
{"title": "all weather perception : joint data association , tracking , and classification for autonomous ground vehicles", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "a novel probabilistic perception algorithm is presented as a real-time joint solution to data association , object tracking , and object classification for an autonomous ground vehicle in all-weather conditions"], ["BODY", "the presented algorithm extends a rao-blackwellized particle filter originally built with a particle filter for data association and a kalman filter for multi-object tracking ( miller et al"], ["BODY", "2011a ) to now also include multiple model tracking for classification"], ["BODY", "additionally a state-of-the-art vision detection algorithm that includes heading information for autonomous ground vehicle ( agv ) applications was implemented"], ["BODY", "cornell 's agv from the darpa urban challenge was upgraded and used to experimentally examine if and how state-of-the-art vision algorithms can complement or replace lidar and radar sensors"], ["BODY", "sensor and algorithm performance in adverse weather and lighting conditions is tested"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental evaluation demonstrates robust all-weather data association , tracking , and classification where camera , lidar , and radar sensors complement each other inside the joint probabilistic perception algorithm ."]], "topics": ["sensor", "autonomous car"]}
{"title": "mixed context networks for semantic segmentation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "semantic segmentation is challenging as it requires both object-level information and pixel-level accuracy"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recently , fcn-based systems gained great improvement in this area"], ["INTRODUCTION", "unlike classification networks , combining features of different layers plays an important role in these dense prediction models , as these features contains information of different levels"], ["INTRODUCTION", "a number of models have been proposed to show how to use these features"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , what is the best architecture to make use of features of different layers is still a question"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a module , called mixed context network , and show that our presented system outperforms most existing semantic segmentation systems by making use of this module ."]], "topics": ["pixel"]}
{"title": "temporal-difference networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a generalization of temporal-difference ( td ) learning to networks of interrelated predictions"], ["BODY", "rather than relating a single prediction to itself at a later time , as in conventional td methods , a td network relates each prediction in a set of predictions to other predictions in the set at a later time"], ["BODY", "td networks can represent and apply td learning to a much wider class of predictions than has previously been possible"], ["BODY", "using a random-walk example , we show that these networks can be used to learn to predict by a fixed interval , which is not possible with conventional td methods"], ["BODY", "secondly , we show that if the inter-predictive relationships are made conditional on action , then the usual learning-efficiency advantage of td methods over monte carlo ( supervised learning ) methods becomes particularly pronounced"], ["BODY", "thirdly , we demonstrate that td networks can learn predictive state representations that enable exact solution of a non-markov problem"], ["BODY", "a very broad range of inter-predictive temporal relationships can be expressed in these networks"], ["CONCLUSION", "overall we argue that td networks represent a substantial extension of the abilities of td methods and bring us closer to the goal of representing world knowledge in entirely predictive , grounded terms ."]], "topics": ["supervised learning", "reinforcement learning"]}
{"title": "evaluating anytime algorithms for learning optimal bayesian networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "exact algorithms for learning bayesian networks guarantee to find provably optimal networks"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , they may fail in difficult learning tasks due to limited time or memory"], ["BODY", "in this research we adapt several anytime heuristic search-based algorithms to learn bayesian networks"], ["BODY", "these algorithms find high-quality solutions quickly , and continually improve the incumbent solution or prove its optimality before resources are exhausted"], ["CONCLUSION", "empirical results show that the anytime window a* algorithm usually finds higher-quality , often optimal , networks more quickly than other approaches"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results also show that , surprisingly , while generating networks with few parents per variable are structurally simpler , they are harder to learn than complex generating networks with more parents per variable ."]], "topics": ["approximation algorithm", "bayesian network"]}
{"title": "ganosaic : mosaic creation with generative texture manifolds", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "this paper presents a novel framework for generating texture mosaics with convolutional neural networks"], ["BODY", "our method is called ganosaic and performs optimization in the latent noise space of a generative texture model , which allows the transformation of a content image into a mosaic exhibiting the visual properties of the underlying texture manifold"], ["BODY", "to represent that manifold , we use a state-of-the-art generative adversarial method for texture synthesis , which can learn expressive texture representations from data and produce mosaic images with very high resolution"], ["BODY", "this fully convolutional model generates smooth ( without any visible borders ) mosaic images which morph and blend different textures locally"], ["CONCLUSION", "in addition , we develop a new type of differentiable statistical regularization appropriate for optimization over the prior noise space of the psgan model ."]], "topics": ["matrix regularization"]}
{"title": "recognition of acoustic events using masked conditional neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "automatic feature extraction using neural networks has accomplished remarkable success for images , but for sound recognition , these models are usually modified to fit the nature of the multi-dimensional temporal representation of the audio signal in spectrograms"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this may not efficiently harness the time-frequency representation of the signal"], ["BODY", "the conditional neural network ( clnn ) takes into consideration the interrelation between the temporal frames , and the masked conditional neural network ( mclnn ) extends upon the clnn by forcing a systematic sparseness over the network 's weights using a binary mask"], ["BODY", "the masking allows the network to learn about frequency bands rather than bins , mimicking a filterbank used in signal transformations such as mfcc"], ["BODY", "additionally , the mask is designed to consider various combinations of features , which automates the feature hand-crafting process"], ["CONCLUSION", "we applied the mclnn for the environmental sound recognition problem using the urbansound8k , yornoise , esc-10 and esc-50 datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "the mclnn have achieved competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art convolutional neural networks and hand-crafted attempts ."]], "topics": ["feature extraction", "neural networks"]}
{"title": "spectral estimation of conditional random graph models for large-scale network data", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "generative models for graphs have been typically committed to strong prior assumptions concerning the form of the modeled distributions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "moreover , the vast majority of currently available models are either only suitable for characterizing some particular network properties ( such as degree distribution or clustering coefficient ) , or they are aimed at estimating joint probability distributions , which is often intractable in large-scale networks"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we first propose a novel network statistic , based on the laplacian spectrum of graphs , which allows to dispense with any parametric assumption concerning the modeled network properties"], ["BODY", "second , we use the defined statistic to develop the fiedler random graph model , switching the focus from the estimation of joint probability distributions to a more tractable conditional estimation setting"], ["BODY", "after analyzing the dependence structure characterizing fiedler random graphs , we evaluate them experimentally in edge prediction over several real-world networks , showing that they allow to reach a much higher prediction accuracy than various alternative statistical models ."]], "topics": ["coefficient"]}
{"title": "real-time alert correlation with type graphs", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the premise of automated alert correlation is to accept that false alerts from a low level intrusion detection system are inevitable and use attack models to explain the output in an understandable way"], ["INTRODUCTION", "several algorithms exist for this purpose which use attack graphs to model the ways in which attacks can be combined"], ["INTRODUCTION", "these algorithms can be classified in to two broad categories namely scenario-graph approaches , which create an attack model starting from a vulnerability assessment and type-graph approaches which rely on an abstract model of the relations between attack types"], ["INTRODUCTION", "some research in to improving the efficiency of type-graph correlation has been carried out but this research has ignored the hypothesizing of missing alerts"], ["BODY", "our work is to present a novel type-graph algorithm which unifies correlation and hypothesizing in to a single operation"], ["CONCLUSION", "our experimental results indicate that the approach is extremely efficient in the face of intensive alerts and produces compact output graphs comparable to other techniques ."]], "topics": ["high- and low-level"]}
{"title": "closed-loop learning of visual control policies", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this paper we present a general , flexible framework for learning mappings from images to actions by interacting with the environment"], ["BODY", "the basic idea is to introduce a feature-based image classifier in front of a reinforcement learning algorithm"], ["BODY", "the classifier partitions the visual space according to the presence or absence of few highly informative local descriptors that are incrementally selected in a sequence of attempts to remove perceptual aliasing"], ["BODY", "we also address the problem of fighting overfitting in such a greedy algorithm"], ["CONCLUSION", "finally , we show how high-level visual features can be generated when the power of local descriptors is insufficient for completely disambiguating the aliased states"], ["CONCLUSION", "this is done by building a hierarchy of composite features that consist of recursive spatial combinations of visual features"], ["CONCLUSION", "we demonstrate the efficacy of our algorithms by solving three visual navigation tasks and a visual version of the classical car on the hill control problem ."]], "topics": ["feature vector", "reinforcement learning"]}
{"title": "denser cities : a system for dense efficient reconstructions of cities", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "this paper is about the efficient generation of dense , colored models of city-scale environments from range data and in particular , stereo cameras"], ["INTRODUCTION", "better maps make for better understanding ; better understanding leads to better robots , but this comes at a cost"], ["BODY", "the computational and memory requirements of large dense models can be prohibitive"], ["BODY", "we provide the theory and the system needed to create city-scale dense reconstructions"], ["BODY", "to do so , we apply a regularizer over a compressed 3d data structure while dealing with the complex boundary conditions this induces during the data-fusion stage"], ["BODY", "we show that only with these considerations can we swiftly create neat , large , `` well behaved '' reconstructions"], ["CONCLUSION", "we evaluate our system using the kitti dataset and provide statistics for the metric errors in all surfaces created compared to those measured with 3d laser"], ["CONCLUSION", "our regularizer reduces the median error by 40 % in 3.4 km of dense reconstructions with a median accuracy of 6 cm"], ["CONCLUSION", "for subjective analysis , we provide a qualitative review of 6.1 km of our dense reconstructions in an attached video"], ["CONCLUSION", "these are the largest dense reconstructions from a single passive camera we are aware of in the literature ."]], "topics": ["map", "robot"]}
