{"title": "compressive acquisition of dynamic scenes", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "compressive sensing ( cs ) is a new approach for the acquisition and recovery of sparse signals and images that enables sampling rates significantly below the classical nyquist rate"], ["INTRODUCTION", "despite significant progress in the theory and methods of cs , little headway has been made in compressive video acquisition and recovery"], ["INTRODUCTION", "video cs is complicated by the ephemeral nature of dynamic events , which makes direct extensions of standard cs imaging architectures and signal models difficult"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we develop a new framework for video cs for dynamic textured scenes that models the evolution of the scene as a linear dynamical system ( lds )"], ["BODY", "this reduces the video recovery problem to first estimating the model parameters of the lds from compressive measurements , and then reconstructing the image frames"], ["BODY", "we exploit the low-dimensional dynamic parameters ( the state sequence ) and high-dimensional static parameters ( the observation matrix ) of the lds to devise a novel compressive measurement strategy that measures only the dynamic part of the scene at each instant and accumulates measurements over time to estimate the static parameters"], ["BODY", "this enables us to lower the compressive measurement rate considerably"], ["CONCLUSION", "we validate our approach with a range of experiments involving both video recovery , sensing hyper-spectral data , and classification of dynamic scenes from compressive data"], ["CONCLUSION", "together , these applications demonstrate the effectiveness of the approach ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "image processing"]}
{"title": "unsupervised sentence simplification using deep semantics", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present a novel approach to sentence simplification which departs from previous work in two main ways"], ["BODY", "first , it requires neither hand written rules nor a training corpus of aligned standard and simplified sentences"], ["BODY", "second , sentence splitting operates on deep semantic structure"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show ( i ) that the unsupervised framework we propose is competitive with four state-of-the-art supervised systems and ( ii ) that our semantic based approach allows for a principled and effective handling of sentence splitting ."]], "topics": ["text corpus"]}
{"title": "constraint reduction using marginal polytope diagrams for map lp relaxations", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "lp relaxation-based message passing algorithms provide an effective tool for map inference over probabilistic graphical models"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , different lp relaxations often have different objective functions and variables of differing dimensions , which presents a barrier to effective comparison and analysis"], ["INTRODUCTION", "in addition , the computational complexity of lp relaxation-based methods grows quickly with the number of constraints"], ["INTRODUCTION", "reducing the number of constraints without sacrificing the quality of the solutions is thus desirable"], ["BODY", "we propose a unified formulation under which existing map lp relaxations may be compared and analysed"], ["BODY", "furthermore , we propose a new tool called marginal polytope diagrams"], ["BODY", "some properties of marginal polytope diagrams are exploited such as node redundancy and edge equivalence"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that using marginal polytope diagrams allows the number of constraints to be reduced without loosening the lp relaxations"], ["CONCLUSION", "then , using marginal polytope diagrams and constraint reduction , we develop three novel message passing algorithms , and demonstrate that two of these show a significant improvement in speed over state-of-art algorithms while delivering a competitive , and sometimes higher , quality of solution ."]], "topics": ["graphical model", "computational complexity theory"]}
{"title": "low-rank label propagation for semi-supervised learning with 100 millions samples", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the success of semi-supervised learning crucially relies on the scalability to a huge amount of unlabelled data that are needed to capture the underlying manifold structure for better classification"], ["INTRODUCTION", "since computing the pairwise similarity between the training data is prohibitively expensive in most kinds of input data , currently , there is no general ready-to-use semi-supervised learning method/tool available for learning with tens of millions or more data points"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we adopted the idea of two low-rank label propagation algorithms , glnp ( global linear neighborhood propagation ) and kernel nystr\\ '' om approximation , and implemented the parallelized version of the two algorithms accelerated with nesterov 's accelerated projected gradient descent for big-data label propagation ( biglp )"], ["CONCLUSION", "the parallel algorithms are tested on five real datasets ranging from 7000 to 10,000,000 in size and a simulation dataset of 100,000,000 samples"], ["CONCLUSION", "in the experiments , the implementation can scale up to datasets with 100,000,000 samples and hundreds of features and the algorithms also significantly improved the prediction accuracy when only a very small percentage of the data is labeled"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results demonstrate that the biglp implementation is highly scalable to big data and effective in utilizing the unlabeled data for semi-supervised learning ."]], "topics": ["test set", "supervised learning"]}
{"title": "stochastic gradient hamiltonian monte carlo", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "hamiltonian monte carlo ( hmc ) sampling methods provide a mechanism for defining distant proposals with high acceptance probabilities in a metropolis-hastings framework , enabling more efficient exploration of the state space than standard random-walk proposals"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the popularity of such methods has grown significantly in recent years"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , a limitation of hmc methods is the required gradient computation for simulation of the hamiltonian dynamical system-such computation is infeasible in problems involving a large sample size or streaming data"], ["INTRODUCTION", "instead , we must rely on a noisy gradient estimate computed from a subset of the data"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we explore the properties of such a stochastic gradient hmc approach"], ["BODY", "surprisingly , the natural implementation of the stochastic approximation can be arbitrarily bad"], ["BODY", "to address this problem we introduce a variant that uses second-order langevin dynamics with a friction term that counteracts the effects of the noisy gradient , maintaining the desired target distribution as the invariant distribution"], ["BODY", "results on simulated data validate our theory"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also provide an application of our methods to a classification task using neural networks and to online bayesian matrix factorization ."]], "topics": ["gradient"]}
{"title": "cognitive psychology for deep neural networks : a shape bias case study", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "deep neural networks ( dnns ) have achieved unprecedented performance on a wide range of complex tasks , rapidly outpacing our understanding of the nature of their solutions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this has caused a recent surge of interest in methods for rendering modern neural systems more interpretable"], ["BODY", "in this work , we propose to address the interpretability problem in modern dnns using the rich history of problem descriptions , theories and experimental methods developed by cognitive psychologists to study the human mind"], ["BODY", "to explore the potential value of these tools , we chose a well-established analysis from developmental psychology that explains how children learn word labels for objects , and applied that analysis to dnns"], ["BODY", "using datasets of stimuli inspired by the original cognitive psychology experiments , we find that state-of-the-art one shot learning models trained on imagenet exhibit a similar bias to that observed in humans : they prefer to categorize objects according to shape rather than color"], ["BODY", "the magnitude of this shape bias varies greatly among architecturally identical , but differently seeded models , and even fluctuates within seeds throughout training , despite nearly equivalent classification performance"], ["CONCLUSION", "these results demonstrate the capability of tools from cognitive psychology for exposing hidden computational properties of dnns , while concurrently providing us with a computational model for human word learning ."]], "topics": ["neural networks", "causality"]}
{"title": "communication-efficient learning of deep networks from decentralized data", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "modern mobile devices have access to a wealth of data suitable for learning models , which in turn can greatly improve the user experience on the device"], ["INTRODUCTION", "for example , language models can improve speech recognition and text entry , and image models can automatically select good photos"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , this rich data is often privacy sensitive , large in quantity , or both , which may preclude logging to the data center and training there using conventional approaches"], ["BODY", "we advocate an alternative that leaves the training data distributed on the mobile devices , and learns a shared model by aggregating locally-computed updates"], ["BODY", "we term this decentralized approach federated learning"], ["BODY", "we present a practical method for the federated learning of deep networks based on iterative model averaging , and conduct an extensive empirical evaluation , considering five different model architectures and four datasets"], ["CONCLUSION", "these experiments demonstrate the approach is robust to the unbalanced and non-iid data distributions that are a defining characteristic of this setting"], ["CONCLUSION", "communication costs are the principal constraint , and we show a reduction in required communication rounds by 10-100x as compared to synchronized stochastic gradient descent ."]], "topics": ["test set", "gradient descent"]}
{"title": "discriminant projection representation-based classification for vision recognition", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "representation-based classification methods such as sparse representation-based classification ( src ) and linear regression classification ( lrc ) have attracted a lot of attentions"], ["BODY", "in order to obtain the better representation , a novel method called projection representation-based classification ( prc ) is proposed for image recognition in this paper"], ["BODY", "prc is based on a new mathematical model"], ["BODY", "this model denotes that the 'ideal projection ' of a sample point $ x $ on the hyper-space $ h $ may be gained by iteratively computing the projection of $ x $ on a line of hyper-space $ h $ with the proper strategy"], ["BODY", "therefore , prc is able to iteratively approximate the 'ideal representation ' of each subject for classification"], ["BODY", "moreover , the discriminant prc ( dprc ) is further proposed , which obtains the discriminant information by maximizing the ratio of the between-class reconstruction error over the within-class reconstruction error"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results on five typical databases show that the proposed prc and dprc are effective and outperform other state-of-the-art methods on several vision recognition tasks ."]], "topics": ["approximation algorithm", "computer vision"]}
{"title": "recurrent models of visual attention", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "applying convolutional neural networks to large images is computationally expensive because the amount of computation scales linearly with the number of image pixels"], ["BODY", "we present a novel recurrent neural network model that is capable of extracting information from an image or video by adaptively selecting a sequence of regions or locations and only processing the selected regions at high resolution"], ["BODY", "like convolutional neural networks , the proposed model has a degree of translation invariance built-in , but the amount of computation it performs can be controlled independently of the input image size"], ["BODY", "while the model is non-differentiable , it can be trained using reinforcement learning methods to learn task-specific policies"], ["CONCLUSION", "we evaluate our model on several image classification tasks , where it significantly outperforms a convolutional neural network baseline on cluttered images , and on a dynamic visual control problem , where it learns to track a simple object without an explicit training signal for doing so ."]], "topics": ["baseline ( configuration management )", "recurrent neural network"]}
{"title": "learning bayesian networks with local structure", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this paper we examine a novel addition to the known methods for learning bayesian networks from data that improves the quality of the learned networks"], ["BODY", "our approach explicitly represents and learns the local structure in the conditional probability tables ( cpts ) , that quantify these networks"], ["BODY", "this increases the space of possible models , enabling the representation of cpts with a variable number of parameters that depends on the learned local structures"], ["BODY", "the resulting learning procedure is capable of inducing models that better emulate the real complexity of the interactions present in the data"], ["BODY", "we describe the theoretical foundations and practical aspects of learning local structures , as well as an empirical evaluation of the proposed method"], ["CONCLUSION", "this evaluation indicates that learning curves characterizing the procedure that exploits the local structure converge faster than these of the standard procedure"], ["CONCLUSION", "our results also show that networks learned with local structure tend to be more complex ( in terms of arcs ) , yet require less parameters ."]], "topics": ["interaction", "bayesian network"]}
{"title": "efficient sampling from time-varying log-concave distributions", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we propose a computationally efficient random walk on a convex body which rapidly mixes and closely tracks a time-varying log-concave distribution"], ["BODY", "we develop general theoretical guarantees on the required number of steps ; this number can be calculated on the fly according to the distance from and the shape of the next distribution"], ["BODY", "we then illustrate the technique on several examples"], ["BODY", "within the context of exponential families , the proposed method produces samples from a posterior distribution which is updated as data arrive in a streaming fashion"], ["BODY", "the sampling technique can be used to track time-varying truncated distributions , as well as to obtain samples from a changing mixture model , fitted in a streaming fashion to data"], ["BODY", "in the setting of linear optimization , the proposed method has oracle complexity with best known dependence on the dimension for certain geometries"], ["BODY", "in the context of online learning and repeated games , the algorithm is an efficient method for implementing no-regret mixture forecasting strategies"], ["CONCLUSION", "remarkably , in some of these examples , only one step of the random walk is needed to track the next distribution ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "regret ( decision theory )"]}
{"title": "on the success rate of crossover operators for genetic programming with offspring selection", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "genetic programming is a powerful heuristic search technique that is used for a number of real world applications to solve among others regression , classification , and time-series forecasting problems"], ["INTRODUCTION", "a lot of progress towards a theoretic description of genetic programming in form of schema theorems has been made , but the internal dynamics and success factors of genetic programming are still not fully understood"], ["INTRODUCTION", "in particular , the effects of different crossover operators in combination with offspring selection are largely unknown"], ["BODY", "this contribution sheds light on the ability of well-known gp crossover operators to create better offspring when applied to benchmark problems"], ["CONCLUSION", "we conclude that standard ( sub-tree swapping ) crossover is a good default choice in combination with offspring selection , and that gp with offspring selection and random selection of crossover operators can improve the performance of the algorithm in terms of best solution quality when no solution size constraints are applied ."]], "topics": ["time series", "heuristic"]}
{"title": "in-order transition-based constituent parsing", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "both bottom-up and top-down strategies have been used for neural transition-based constituent parsing"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the parsing strategies differ in terms of the order in which they recognize productions in the derivation tree , where bottom-up strategies and top-down strategies take post-order and pre-order traversal over trees , respectively"], ["BODY", "bottom-up parsers benefit from rich features from readily built partial parses , but lack lookahead guidance in the parsing process ; top-down parsers benefit from non-local guidance for local decisions , but rely on a strong encoder over the input to predict a constituent hierarchy before its construction.to mitigate both issues , we propose a novel parsing system based on in-order traversal over syntactic trees , designing a set of transition actions to find a compromise between bottom-up constituent information and top-down lookahead information"], ["CONCLUSION", "based on stack-lstm , our psycholinguistically motivated constituent parsing system achieves 91.8 f1 on wsj benchmark"], ["CONCLUSION", "furthermore , the system achieves 93.6 f1 with supervised reranking and 94.2 f1 with semi-supervised reranking , which are the best results on the wsj benchmark ."]], "topics": ["parsing", "encoder"]}
{"title": "stroke sequence-dependent deep convolutional neural network for online handwritten chinese character recognition", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this paper , we propose a novel model , named stroke sequence-dependent deep convolutional neural network ( ssdcnn ) , using the stroke sequence information and eight-directional features for online handwritten chinese character recognition ( olhccr )"], ["BODY", "on one hand , ssdcnn can learn the representation of online handwritten chinese character ( olhcc ) by incorporating the natural sequence information of the strokes"], ["BODY", "on the other hand , ssdcnn can incorporate eight-directional features in a natural way"], ["BODY", "in order to train ssdcnn , we divide the process of training into two stages : 1 ) the training data is used to pre-train the whole architecture until the performance tends to converge"], ["BODY", "2 ) fully-connected neural network which is used to combine the stroke sequence-dependent representation with eight-directional features and softmax layer are further trained"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments were conducted on the olhccr competition tasks of icdar 2013"], ["CONCLUSION", "results show that , ssdcnn can reduce the recognition error by 50\\ % ( 5.13\\ % vs 2.56\\ % ) compared to the model which only use eight-directional features"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed ssdcnn achieves 97.44\\ % accuracy which reduces the recognition error by about 1.9\\ % compared with the best submitted system on icdar2013 competition"], ["CONCLUSION", "these results indicate that ssdcnn can exploit the stroke sequence information to learn high-quality representation of olhcc"], ["CONCLUSION", "it also shows that the learnt representation and the classical eight-directional features complement each other within the ssdcnn architecture ."]], "topics": ["test set", "map"]}
{"title": "omg u got flu ? analysis of shared health messages for bio-surveillance", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "background : micro-blogging services such as twitter offer the potential to crowdsource epidemics in real-time"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , twitter posts ( 'tweets ' ) are often ambiguous and reactive to media trends"], ["BODY", "in order to ground user messages in epidemic response we focused on tracking reports of self-protective behaviour such as avoiding public gatherings or increased sanitation as the basis for further risk analysis"], ["BODY", "results : we created guidelines for tagging self protective behaviour based on jones and salath\\'e ( 2009 ) 's behaviour response survey"], ["CONCLUSION", "applying the guidelines to a corpus of 5283 twitter messages related to influenza like illness showed a high level of inter-annotator agreement ( kappa 0.86 )"], ["CONCLUSION", "we employed supervised learning using unigrams , bigrams and regular expressions as features with two supervised classifiers ( svm and naive bayes ) to classify tweets into 4 self-reported protective behaviour categories plus a self-reported diagnosis"], ["BODY", "in addition to classification performance we report moderately strong spearman 's rho correlation by comparing classifier output against who/nrevss laboratory data for a ( h1n1 ) in the usa during the 2009-2010 influenza season"], ["CONCLUSION", "conclusions : the study adds to evidence supporting a high degree of correlation between pre-diagnostic social media signals and diagnostic influenza case data , pointing the way towards low cost sensor networks"], ["CONCLUSION", "we believe that the signals we have modelled may be applicable to a wide range of diseases ."]], "topics": ["supervised learning", "text corpus"]}
{"title": "note on attacking object detectors with adversarial stickers", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "deep learning has proven to be a powerful tool for computer vision and has seen widespread adoption for numerous tasks"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , deep learning algorithms are known to be vulnerable to adversarial examples"], ["INTRODUCTION", "these adversarial inputs are created such that , when provided to a deep learning algorithm , they are very likely to be mislabeled"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this can be problematic when deep learning is used to assist in safety critical decisions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recent research has shown that classifiers can be attacked by physical adversarial examples under various physical conditions"], ["BODY", "given the fact that state-of-the-art objection detection algorithms are harder to be fooled by the same set of adversarial examples , here we show that these detectors can also be attacked by physical adversarial examples"], ["BODY", "in this note , we briefly show both static and dynamic test results"], ["BODY", "we design an algorithm that produces physical adversarial inputs , which can fool the yolo object detector and can also attack faster-rcnn with relatively high success rate based on transferability"], ["BODY", "furthermore , our algorithm can compress the size of the adversarial inputs to stickers that , when attached to the targeted object , result in the detector either mislabeling or not detecting the object a high percentage of the time"], ["CONCLUSION", "this note provides a small set of results"], ["CONCLUSION", "our upcoming paper will contain a thorough evaluation on other object detectors , and will present the algorithm ."]], "topics": ["computer vision"]}
{"title": "large-scale low-rank matrix learning with nonconvex regularizers", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "low-rank modeling has many important applications in computer vision and machine learning"], ["INTRODUCTION", "while the matrix rank is often approximated by the convex nuclear norm , the use of nonconvex low-rank regularizers has demonstrated better empirical performance"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , the resulting optimization problem is much more challenging"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recent state-of-the-art requires an expensive full svd in each iteration"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we show that for many commonly-used nonconvex low-rank regularizers , a cutoff can be derived to automatically threshold the singular values obtained from the proximal operator"], ["BODY", "this allows such operator being efficiently approximated by power method"], ["BODY", "based on it , we develop a proximal gradient algorithm ( and its accelerated variant ) with inexact proximal splitting and prove that a convergence rate of o ( 1/t ) where t is the number of iterations is guaranteed"], ["CONCLUSION", "furthermore , we show the proposed algorithm can be well parallelized , which achieves nearly linear speedup w.r.t the number of threads"], ["CONCLUSION", "extensive experiments are performed on matrix completion and robust principal component analysis , which shows a significant speedup over the state-of-the-art"], ["CONCLUSION", "moreover , the matrix solution obtained is more accurate and has a lower rank than that of the nuclear norm regularizer ."]], "topics": ["optimization problem", "computer vision"]}
{"title": "deep multimodal speaker naming", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "automatic speaker naming is the problem of localizing as well as identifying each speaking character in a tv/movie/live show video"], ["INTRODUCTION", "this is a challenging problem mainly attributes to its multimodal nature , namely face cue alone is insufficient to achieve good performance"], ["INTRODUCTION", "previous multimodal approaches to this problem usually process the data of different modalities individually and merge them using handcrafted heuristics"], ["INTRODUCTION", "such approaches work well for simple scenes , but fail to achieve high performance for speakers with large appearance variations"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel convolutional neural networks ( cnn ) based learning framework to automatically learn the fusion function of both face and audio cues"], ["BODY", "we show that without using face tracking , facial landmark localization or subtitle/transcript , our system with robust multimodal feature extraction is able to achieve state-of-the-art speaker naming performance evaluated on two diverse tv series"], ["CONCLUSION", "the dataset and implementation of our algorithm are publicly available online ."]], "topics": ["feature extraction", "heuristic"]}
{"title": "dropout with expectation-linear regularization", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "dropout , a simple and effective way to train deep neural networks , has led to a number of impressive empirical successes and spawned many recent theoretical investigations"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , the gap between dropout 's training and inference phases , introduced due to tractability considerations , has largely remained under-appreciated"], ["BODY", "in this work , we first formulate dropout as a tractable approximation of some latent variable model , leading to a clean view of parameter sharing and enabling further theoretical analysis"], ["BODY", "then , we introduce ( approximate ) expectation-linear dropout neural networks , whose inference gap we are able to formally characterize"], ["BODY", "algorithmically , we show that our proposed measure of the inference gap can be used to regularize the standard dropout training objective , resulting in an \\emph { explicit } control of the gap"], ["BODY", "our method is as simple and efficient as standard dropout"], ["BODY", "we further prove the upper bounds on the loss in accuracy due to expectation-linearization , describe classes of input distributions that expectation-linearize easily"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments on three image classification benchmark datasets demonstrate that reducing the inference gap can indeed improve the performance consistently ."]], "topics": ["approximation algorithm", "matrix regularization"]}
{"title": "application of quantum annealing to training of deep neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in deep learning , a well-known approach for training a deep neural network starts by training a generative deep belief network model , typically using contrastive divergence ( cd ) , then fine-tuning the weights using backpropagation or other discriminative techniques"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , the generative training can be time-consuming due to the slow mixing of gibbs sampling"], ["BODY", "we investigated an alternative approach that estimates model expectations of restricted boltzmann machines using samples from a d-wave quantum annealing machine"], ["BODY", "we tested this method on a coarse-grained version of the mnist data set"], ["CONCLUSION", "in our tests we found that the quantum sampling-based training approach achieves comparable or better accuracy with significantly fewer iterations of generative training than conventional cd-based training"], ["CONCLUSION", "further investigation is needed to determine whether similar improvements can be achieved for other data sets , and to what extent these improvements can be attributed to quantum effects ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "iteration"]}
{"title": "adversarially regularized graph autoencoder", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "graph embedding is an effective method to represent graph data in a low dimensional space for graph analytics"], ["INTRODUCTION", "most existing embedding algorithms typically focus on preserving the topological structure or minimizing the reconstruction errors of graph data , but they have mostly ignored the data distribution of the latent codes from the graphs , which often results in inferior embedding in real-world graph data"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel adversarial graph embedding framework for graph data"], ["BODY", "the framework encodes the topological structure and node content in a graph to a compact representation , on which a decoder is trained to reconstruct the graph structure"], ["BODY", "furthermore , the latent representation is enforced to match a prior distribution via an adversarial training scheme"], ["BODY", "to learn a robust embedding , two variants of adversarial approaches , adversarially regularized graph autoencoder ( arga ) and adversarially regularized variational graph autoencoder ( arvga ) , are developed"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental studies on real-world graphs validate our design and demonstrate that our algorithms outperform baselines by a wide margin in link prediction , graph clustering , and graph visualization tasks ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "calculus of variations"]}
{"title": "learning steerable filters for rotation equivariant cnns", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in many machine learning tasks it is desirable that a model 's prediction transforms in an equivariant way under transformations of its input"], ["INTRODUCTION", "convolutional neural networks ( cnns ) implement translational equivariance by construction ; for other transformations , however , they are compelled to learn the proper mapping"], ["BODY", "in this work , we develop steerable filter cnns ( sfcnns ) which achieve joint equivariance under translations and rotations by design"], ["BODY", "the proposed architecture employs steerable filters to efficiently compute orientation dependent responses for many orientations without suffering interpolation artifacts from filter rotation"], ["BODY", "we utilize group convolutions which guarantee an equivariant mapping"], ["BODY", "in addition , we generalize he 's weight initialization scheme to filters which are defined as a linear combination of a system of atomic filters"], ["CONCLUSION", "numerical experiments show a substantial enhancement of the sample complexity with a growing number of sampled filter orientations and confirm that the network generalizes learned patterns over orientations"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed approach achieves state-of-the-art on the rotated mnist benchmark and on the isbi 2012 2d em segmentation challenge ."]], "topics": ["convolution", "mnist database"]}
{"title": "deep learning with energy-efficient binary gradient cameras", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "power consumption is a critical factor for the deployment of embedded computer vision systems"], ["BODY", "we explore the use of computational cameras that directly output binary gradient images to reduce the portion of the power consumption allocated to image sensing"], ["BODY", "we survey the accuracy of binary gradient cameras on a number of computer vision tasks using deep learning"], ["BODY", "these include object recognition , head pose regression , face detection , and gesture recognition"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that , for certain applications , accuracy can be on par or even better than what can be achieved on traditional images"], ["CONCLUSION", "we are also the first to recover intensity information from binary spatial gradient images -- useful for applications with a human observer in the loop , such as surveillance"], ["CONCLUSION", "our results , which we validate with a prototype binary gradient camera , point to the potential of gradient-based computer vision systems ."]], "topics": ["computer vision", "gradient"]}
{"title": "variational program inference", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a framework for representing a variety of interesting problems as inference over the execution of probabilistic model programs"], ["BODY", "we represent a `` solution '' to such a problem as a guide program which runs alongside the model program and influences the model program 's random choices , leading the model program to sample from a different distribution than from its priors"], ["BODY", "ideally the guide program influences the model program to sample from the posteriors given the evidence"], ["BODY", "we show how the kl- divergence between the true posterior distribution and the distribution induced by the guided model program can be efficiently estimated ( up to an additive constant ) by sampling multiple executions of the guided model program"], ["CONCLUSION", "in addition , we show how to use the guide program as a proposal distribution in importance sampling to statistically prove lower bounds on the probability of the evidence and on the probability of a hypothesis and the evidence"], ["CONCLUSION", "we can use the quotient of these two bounds as an estimate of the conditional probability of the hypothesis given the evidence"], ["CONCLUSION", "we thus turn the inference problem into a heuristic search for better guide programs ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "value ( ethics )"]}

{"title": "scalable discovery of time-series shapelets", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "time-series classification is an important problem for the data mining community due to the wide range of application domains involving time-series data"], ["INTRODUCTION", "a recent paradigm , called shapelets , represents patterns that are highly predictive for the target variable"], ["INTRODUCTION", "shapelets are discovered by measuring the prediction accuracy of a set of potential ( shapelet ) candidates"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the candidates typically consist of all the segments of a dataset , therefore , the discovery of shapelets is computationally expensive"], ["BODY", "this paper proposes a novel method that avoids measuring the prediction accuracy of similar candidates in euclidean distance space , through an online clustering pruning technique"], ["BODY", "in addition , our algorithm incorporates a supervised shapelet selection that filters out only those candidates that improve classification accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "empirical evidence on 45 datasets from the ucr collection demonstrate that our method is 3-4 orders of magnitudes faster than the fastest existing shapelet-discovery method , while providing better prediction accuracy ."]], "topics": ["data mining", "cluster analysis"]}

{"title": "object detection with mask-based feature encoding", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "region-based convolutional neural networks ( r-cnns ) have achieved great success in the field of object detection"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the existing r-cnns usually divide a region-of-interest ( roi ) into grids , and then localize objects by utilizing the spatial information reflected by the relative position of each grid in the roi"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel feature-encoding approach , where spatial information is represented through the spatial distributions of visual patterns"], ["BODY", "in particular , we design a mask weight network ( mwn ) to learn a set of masks and then apply channel-wise masking operations to roi feature map , followed by a global pooling and a cheap fully-connected layer"], ["BODY", "we integrate the newly designed feature encoder into the faster r-cnn architecture"], ["CONCLUSION", "the resulting new faster r-cnns can preserve the object-detection accuracy of the standard faster r-cnns by using substantially fewer parameters"], ["CONCLUSION", "compared to r-fcns using state-of-art ps roi pooling and deformable ps roi pooling , the new faster r-cnns can produce higher object-detection accuracy with good run-time efficiency"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also show that a specifically designed and learned mwn can capture global contextual information and further improve the object-detection accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "validation experiments are conducted on both pascal voc and ms coco datasets ."]], "topics": ["object detection", "encoder"]}

{"title": "probabilistic combination of classifier and cluster ensembles for non-transductive learning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "unsupervised models can provide supplementary soft constraints to help classify new target data under the assumption that similar objects in the target set are more likely to share the same class label"], ["INTRODUCTION", "such models can also help detect possible differences between training and target distributions , which is useful in applications where concept drift may take place"], ["BODY", "this paper describes a bayesian framework that takes as input class labels from existing classifiers ( designed based on labeled data from the source domain ) , as well as cluster labels from a cluster ensemble operating solely on the target data to be classified , and yields a consensus labeling of the target data"], ["BODY", "this framework is particularly useful when the statistics of the target data drift or change from those of the training data"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also show that the proposed framework is privacy-aware and allows performing distributed learning when data/models have sharing restrictions"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments show that our framework can yield superior results to those provided by applying classifier ensembles only ."]], "topics": ["test set"]}
{"title": "dialogue act tagging with transformation-based learning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "for the task of recognizing dialogue acts , we are applying the transformation-based learning ( tbl ) machine learning algorithm"], ["BODY", "to circumvent a sparse data problem , we extract values of well-motivated features of utterances , such as speaker direction , punctuation marks , and a new feature , called dialogue act cues , which we find to be more effective than cue phrases and word n-grams in practice"], ["BODY", "we present strategies for constructing a set of dialogue act cues automatically by minimizing the entropy of the distribution of dialogue acts in a training corpus , filtering out irrelevant dialogue act cues , and clustering semantically-related words"], ["BODY", "in addition , to address limitations of tbl , we introduce a monte carlo strategy for training efficiently and a committee method for computing confidence measures"], ["CONCLUSION", "these ideas are combined in our working implementation , which labels held-out data as accurately as any other reported system for the dialogue act tagging task ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "value ( ethics )"]}
{"title": "classification of segments in polsar imagery by minimum stochastic distances between wishart distributions", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "a new classifier for polarimetric sar ( polsar ) images is proposed and assessed in this paper"], ["BODY", "its input consists of segments , and each one is assigned the class which minimizes a stochastic distance"], ["BODY", "assuming the complex wishart model , several stochastic distances are obtained from the h-phi family of divergences , and they are employed to derive hypothesis test statistics that are also used in the classification process"], ["BODY", "this article also presents , as a novelty , analytic expressions for the test statistics based on the following stochastic distances between complex wishart models : kullback-leibler , bhattacharyya , hellinger , r\\'enyi , and chi-square ; also , the test statistic based on the bhattacharyya distance between multivariate gaussian distributions is presented"], ["BODY", "the classifier performance is evaluated using simulated and real polsar data"], ["BODY", "the simulated data are based on the complex wishart model , aiming at the analysis of the proposal well controlled data"], ["CONCLUSION", "the real data refer to the complex l-band image , acquired during the 1994 sir-c mission"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results of the proposed classifier are compared with those obtained by a wishart per-pixel/contextual classifier , and we show the better performance of the region-based classification"], ["CONCLUSION", "the influence of the statistical modeling is assessed by comparing the results using the bhattacharyya distance between multivariate gaussian distributions for amplitude data"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results with simulated data indicate that the proposed classification method has a very good performance when the data follow the wishart model"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed classifier also performs better than the per-pixel/contextual classifier and the bhattacharyya gaussian distance using sir-c polsar data ."]], "topics": ["simulation", "pixel"]}
{"title": "partial sum minimization of singular values representation on grassmann manifolds", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "as a significant subspace clustering method , low rank representation ( lrr ) has attracted great attention in recent years"], ["INTRODUCTION", "to further improve the performance of lrr and extend its applications , there are several issues to be resolved"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the nuclear norm in lrr does not sufficiently use the prior knowledge of the rank which is known in many practical problems"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the lrr is designed for vectorial data from linear spaces , thus not suitable for high dimensional data with intrinsic non-linear manifold structure"], ["BODY", "this paper proposes an extended lrr model for manifold-valued grassmann data which incorporates prior knowledge by minimizing partial sum of singular values instead of the nuclear norm , namely partial sum minimization of singular values representation ( gpssvr )"], ["BODY", "the new model not only enforces the global structure of data in low rank , but also retains important information by minimizing only smaller singular values"], ["BODY", "to further maintain the local structures among grassmann points , we also integrate the laplacian penalty with gpssvr"], ["BODY", "an effective algorithm is proposed to solve the optimization problem based on the gpssvr model"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed model and algorithms are assessed on some widely used human action video datasets and a real scenery dataset"], ["CONCLUSION", "the experimental results show that the proposed methods obviously outperform other state-of-the-art methods ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "data mining"]}
{"title": "political speech generation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this report we present a system that can generate political speeches for a desired political party"], ["BODY", "furthermore , the system allows to specify whether a speech should hold a supportive or opposing opinion"], ["BODY", "the system relies on a combination of several state-of-the-art nlp methods which are discussed in this report"], ["BODY", "these include n-grams , justeson & katz pos tag filter , recurrent neural networks , and latent dirichlet allocation"], ["BODY", "sequences of words are generated based on probabilities obtained from two underlying models : a language model takes care of the grammatical correctness while a topic model aims for textual consistency"], ["BODY", "both models were trained on the convote dataset which contains transcripts from us congressional floor debates"], ["CONCLUSION", "furthermore , we present a manual and an automated approach to evaluate the quality of generated speeches"], ["CONCLUSION", "in an experimental evaluation generated speeches have shown very high quality in terms of grammatical correctness and sentence transitions ."]], "topics": ["natural language processing", "recurrent neural network"]}
{"title": "rollout sampling policy iteration for decentralized pomdps", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present decentralized rollout sampling policy iteration ( decrspi ) - a new algorithm for multi-agent decision problems formalized as dec-pomdps"], ["BODY", "decrspi is designed to improve scalability and tackle problems that lack an explicit model"], ["BODY", "the algorithm uses monte- carlo methods to generate a sample of reachable belief states"], ["BODY", "then it computes a joint policy for each belief state based on the rollout estimations"], ["BODY", "a new policy representation allows us to represent solutions compactly"], ["BODY", "the key benefits of the algorithm are its linear time complexity over the number of agents , its bounded memory usage and good solution quality"], ["CONCLUSION", "it can solve larger problems that are intractable for existing planning algorithms"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results confirm the effectiveness and scalability of the approach ."]], "topics": ["time complexity", "iteration"]}
{"title": "one-shot learning in discriminative neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we consider the task of one-shot learning of visual categories"], ["BODY", "in this paper we explore a bayesian procedure for updating a pretrained convnet to classify a novel image category for which data is limited"], ["BODY", "we decompose this convnet into a fixed feature extractor and softmax classifier"], ["BODY", "we assume that the target weights for the new task come from the same distribution as the pretrained softmax weights , which we model as a multivariate gaussian"], ["CONCLUSION", "by using this as a prior for the new weights , we demonstrate competitive performance with state-of-the-art methods whilst also being consistent with 'normal ' methods for training deep networks on large data ."]], "topics": ["test set", "mathematical optimization"]}
{"title": "spatial mapping with gaussian processes and nonstationary fourier features", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the use of covariance kernels is ubiquitous in the field of spatial statistics"], ["INTRODUCTION", "kernels allow data to be mapped into high-dimensional feature spaces and can thus extend simple linear additive methods to nonlinear methods with higher order interactions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , until recently , there has been a strong reliance on a limited class of stationary kernels such as the matern or squared exponential , limiting the expressiveness of these modelling approaches"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recent machine learning research has focused on spectral representations to model arbitrary stationary kernels and introduced more general representations that include classes of nonstationary kernels"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we exploit the connections between fourier feature representations , gaussian processes and neural networks to generalise previous approaches and develop a simple and efficient framework to learn arbitrarily complex nonstationary kernel functions directly from the data , while taking care to avoid overfitting using state-of-the-art methods from deep learning"], ["BODY", "we highlight the very broad array of kernel classes that could be created within this framework"], ["BODY", "we apply this to a time series dataset and a remote sensing problem involving land surface temperature in eastern africa"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that without increasing the computational or storage complexity , nonstationary kernels can be used to improve generalisation performance and provide more interpretable results ."]], "topics": ["kernel ( operating system )", "time series"]}

{"title": "parsing english with a link grammar", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we develop a formal grammatical system called a link grammar , show how english grammar can be encoded in such a system , and give algorithms for efficiently parsing with a link grammar"], ["BODY", "although the expressive power of link grammars is equivalent to that of context free grammars , encoding natural language grammars appears to be much easier with the new system"], ["BODY", "we have written a program for general link parsing and written a link grammar for the english language"], ["CONCLUSION", "the performance of this preliminary system -- both in the breadth of english phenomena that it captures and in the computational resources used -- indicates that the approach may have practical uses as well as linguistic significance"], ["CONCLUSION", "our program is written in c and may be obtained through the internet ."]], "topics": ["natural language", "parsing"]}
{"title": "memory-based control with recurrent neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "partially observed control problems are a challenging aspect of reinforcement learning"], ["BODY", "we extend two related , model-free algorithms for continuous control -- deterministic policy gradient and stochastic value gradient -- to solve partially observed domains using recurrent neural networks trained with backpropagation through time"], ["BODY", "we demonstrate that this approach , coupled with long-short term memory is able to solve a variety of physical control problems exhibiting an assortment of memory requirements"], ["BODY", "these include the short-term integration of information from noisy sensors and the identification of system parameters , as well as long-term memory problems that require preserving information over many time steps"], ["BODY", "we also demonstrate success on a combined exploration and memory problem in the form of a simplified version of the well-known morris water maze task"], ["CONCLUSION", "finally , we show that our approach can deal with high-dimensional observations by learning directly from pixels"], ["CONCLUSION", "we find that recurrent deterministic and stochastic policies are able to learn similarly good solutions to these tasks , including the water maze where the agent must learn effective search strategies ."]], "topics": ["recurrent neural network", "reinforcement learning"]}
{"title": "improving the neural gpu architecture for algorithm learning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "algorithm learning is a core problem in artificial intelligence with significant implications on automation level that can be achieved by machines"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recently deep learning methods are emerging for synthesizing an algorithm from its input-output examples , the most successful being the neural gpu , capable of learning multiplication"], ["BODY", "we present several improvements to the neural gpu that substantially reduces training time and improves generalization"], ["BODY", "we introduce a technique of general applicability to use hard nonlinearities with saturation cost"], ["BODY", "we also introduce a technique of diagonal gates that can be applied to active-memory models"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed architecture is the first capable of learning decimal multiplication end-to-end ."]], "topics": ["end-to-end principle", "artificial intelligence"]}
{"title": "pointfusion : deep sensor fusion for 3d bounding box estimation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present pointfusion , a generic 3d object detection method that leverages both image and 3d point cloud information"], ["BODY", "unlike existing methods that either use multi-stage pipelines or hold sensor and dataset-specific assumptions , pointfusion is conceptually simple and application-agnostic"], ["BODY", "the image data and the raw point cloud data are independently processed by a cnn and a pointnet architecture , respectively"], ["BODY", "the resulting outputs are then combined by a novel fusion network , which predicts multiple 3d box hypotheses and their confidences , using the input 3d points as spatial anchors"], ["BODY", "we evaluate pointfusion on two distinctive datasets : the kitti dataset that features driving scenes captured with a lidar-camera setup , and the sun-rgbd dataset that captures indoor environments with rgb-d cameras"], ["CONCLUSION", "our model is the first one that is able to perform better or on-par with the state-of-the-art on these diverse datasets without any dataset-specific model tuning ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "object detection"]}
{"title": "a simple approach to building ensembles of naive bayesian classifiers for word sense disambiguation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "this paper presents a corpus-based approach to word sense disambiguation that builds an ensemble of naive bayesian classifiers , each of which is based on lexical features that represent co -- occurring words in varying sized windows of context"], ["BODY", "despite the simplicity of this approach , empirical results disambiguating the widely studied nouns line and interest show that such an ensemble achieves accuracy rivaling the best previously published results ."]], "topics": ["statistical classification", "supervised learning"]}
{"title": "application of quantum annealing to training of deep neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in deep learning , a well-known approach for training a deep neural network starts by training a generative deep belief network model , typically using contrastive divergence ( cd ) , then fine-tuning the weights using backpropagation or other discriminative techniques"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , the generative training can be time-consuming due to the slow mixing of gibbs sampling"], ["BODY", "we investigated an alternative approach that estimates model expectations of restricted boltzmann machines using samples from a d-wave quantum annealing machine"], ["BODY", "we tested this method on a coarse-grained version of the mnist data set"], ["CONCLUSION", "in our tests we found that the quantum sampling-based training approach achieves comparable or better accuracy with significantly fewer iterations of generative training than conventional cd-based training"], ["CONCLUSION", "further investigation is needed to determine whether similar improvements can be achieved for other data sets , and to what extent these improvements can be attributed to quantum effects ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "iteration"]}
{"title": "adversarially regularized graph autoencoder", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "graph embedding is an effective method to represent graph data in a low dimensional space for graph analytics"], ["INTRODUCTION", "most existing embedding algorithms typically focus on preserving the topological structure or minimizing the reconstruction errors of graph data , but they have mostly ignored the data distribution of the latent codes from the graphs , which often results in inferior embedding in real-world graph data"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel adversarial graph embedding framework for graph data"], ["BODY", "the framework encodes the topological structure and node content in a graph to a compact representation , on which a decoder is trained to reconstruct the graph structure"], ["BODY", "furthermore , the latent representation is enforced to match a prior distribution via an adversarial training scheme"], ["BODY", "to learn a robust embedding , two variants of adversarial approaches , adversarially regularized graph autoencoder ( arga ) and adversarially regularized variational graph autoencoder ( arvga ) , are developed"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental studies on real-world graphs validate our design and demonstrate that our algorithms outperform baselines by a wide margin in link prediction , graph clustering , and graph visualization tasks ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "calculus of variations"]}
{"title": "learning steerable filters for rotation equivariant cnns", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in many machine learning tasks it is desirable that a model 's prediction transforms in an equivariant way under transformations of its input"], ["INTRODUCTION", "convolutional neural networks ( cnns ) implement translational equivariance by construction ; for other transformations , however , they are compelled to learn the proper mapping"], ["BODY", "in this work , we develop steerable filter cnns ( sfcnns ) which achieve joint equivariance under translations and rotations by design"], ["BODY", "the proposed architecture employs steerable filters to efficiently compute orientation dependent responses for many orientations without suffering interpolation artifacts from filter rotation"], ["BODY", "we utilize group convolutions which guarantee an equivariant mapping"], ["BODY", "in addition , we generalize he 's weight initialization scheme to filters which are defined as a linear combination of a system of atomic filters"], ["CONCLUSION", "numerical experiments show a substantial enhancement of the sample complexity with a growing number of sampled filter orientations and confirm that the network generalizes learned patterns over orientations"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed approach achieves state-of-the-art on the rotated mnist benchmark and on the isbi 2012 2d em segmentation challenge ."]], "topics": ["convolution", "mnist database"]}
{"title": "deep learning with energy-efficient binary gradient cameras", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "power consumption is a critical factor for the deployment of embedded computer vision systems"], ["BODY", "we explore the use of computational cameras that directly output binary gradient images to reduce the portion of the power consumption allocated to image sensing"], ["BODY", "we survey the accuracy of binary gradient cameras on a number of computer vision tasks using deep learning"], ["BODY", "these include object recognition , head pose regression , face detection , and gesture recognition"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that , for certain applications , accuracy can be on par or even better than what can be achieved on traditional images"], ["CONCLUSION", "we are also the first to recover intensity information from binary spatial gradient images -- useful for applications with a human observer in the loop , such as surveillance"], ["CONCLUSION", "our results , which we validate with a prototype binary gradient camera , point to the potential of gradient-based computer vision systems ."]], "topics": ["computer vision", "gradient"]}
{"title": "variational program inference", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we introduce a framework for representing a variety of interesting problems as inference over the execution of probabilistic model programs"], ["BODY", "we represent a `` solution '' to such a problem as a guide program which runs alongside the model program and influences the model program 's random choices , leading the model program to sample from a different distribution than from its priors"], ["BODY", "ideally the guide program influences the model program to sample from the posteriors given the evidence"], ["BODY", "we show how the kl- divergence between the true posterior distribution and the distribution induced by the guided model program can be efficiently estimated ( up to an additive constant ) by sampling multiple executions of the guided model program"], ["CONCLUSION", "in addition , we show how to use the guide program as a proposal distribution in importance sampling to statistically prove lower bounds on the probability of the evidence and on the probability of a hypothesis and the evidence"], ["CONCLUSION", "we can use the quotient of these two bounds as an estimate of the conditional probability of the hypothesis given the evidence"], ["CONCLUSION", "we thus turn the inference problem into a heuristic search for better guide programs ."]], "topics": ["sampling ( signal processing )", "value ( ethics )"]}

{"title": "scalable discovery of time-series shapelets", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "time-series classification is an important problem for the data mining community due to the wide range of application domains involving time-series data"], ["INTRODUCTION", "a recent paradigm , called shapelets , represents patterns that are highly predictive for the target variable"], ["INTRODUCTION", "shapelets are discovered by measuring the prediction accuracy of a set of potential ( shapelet ) candidates"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the candidates typically consist of all the segments of a dataset , therefore , the discovery of shapelets is computationally expensive"], ["BODY", "this paper proposes a novel method that avoids measuring the prediction accuracy of similar candidates in euclidean distance space , through an online clustering pruning technique"], ["BODY", "in addition , our algorithm incorporates a supervised shapelet selection that filters out only those candidates that improve classification accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "empirical evidence on 45 datasets from the ucr collection demonstrate that our method is 3-4 orders of magnitudes faster than the fastest existing shapelet-discovery method , while providing better prediction accuracy ."]], "topics": ["data mining", "cluster analysis"]}
{"title": "fuzzy human motion analysis : a review", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "human motion analysis ( hma ) is currently one of the most popularly active research domains as such significant research interests are motivated by a number of real world applications such as video surveillance , sports analysis , healthcare monitoring and so on"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , most of these real world applications face high levels of uncertainties that can affect the operations of such applications"], ["INTRODUCTION", "hence , the fuzzy set theory has been applied and showed great success in the recent past"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we aim at reviewing the fuzzy set oriented approaches for hma , individuating how the fuzzy set may improve the hma , envisaging and delineating the future perspectives"], ["BODY", "to the best of our knowledge , there is not found a single survey in the current literature that has discussed and reviewed fuzzy approaches towards the hma"], ["CONCLUSION", "for ease of understanding , we conceptually classify the human motion into three broad levels : low-level ( lol ) , mid-level ( mil ) , and high-level ( hil ) hma ."]], "topics": ["high- and low-level"]}
{"title": "a fast statistical method for multilevel thresholding in wavelet domain", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "an algorithm is proposed for the segmentation of image into multiple levels using mean and standard deviation in the wavelet domain"], ["BODY", "the procedure provides for variable size segmentation with bigger block size around the mean , and having smaller blocks at the ends of histogram plot of each horizontal , vertical and diagonal components , while for the approximation component it provides for finer block size around the mean , and larger blocks at the ends of histogram plot coefficients"], ["BODY", "it is found that the proposed algorithm has significantly less time complexity , achieves superior psnr and structural similarity measurement index as compared to similar space domain algorithms [ 1 ]"], ["CONCLUSION", "in the process it highlights finer image structures not perceptible in the original image"], ["CONCLUSION", "it is worth emphasizing that after the segmentation only 16 ( at threshold level 3 ) wavelet coefficients captures the significant variation of image ."]], "topics": ["time complexity", "coefficient"]}

{"title": "object detection with mask-based feature encoding", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "region-based convolutional neural networks ( r-cnns ) have achieved great success in the field of object detection"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the existing r-cnns usually divide a region-of-interest ( roi ) into grids , and then localize objects by utilizing the spatial information reflected by the relative position of each grid in the roi"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we propose a novel feature-encoding approach , where spatial information is represented through the spatial distributions of visual patterns"], ["BODY", "in particular , we design a mask weight network ( mwn ) to learn a set of masks and then apply channel-wise masking operations to roi feature map , followed by a global pooling and a cheap fully-connected layer"], ["BODY", "we integrate the newly designed feature encoder into the faster r-cnn architecture"], ["CONCLUSION", "the resulting new faster r-cnns can preserve the object-detection accuracy of the standard faster r-cnns by using substantially fewer parameters"], ["CONCLUSION", "compared to r-fcns using state-of-art ps roi pooling and deformable ps roi pooling , the new faster r-cnns can produce higher object-detection accuracy with good run-time efficiency"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also show that a specifically designed and learned mwn can capture global contextual information and further improve the object-detection accuracy"], ["CONCLUSION", "validation experiments are conducted on both pascal voc and ms coco datasets ."]], "topics": ["object detection", "encoder"]}
{"title": "text region extraction from business card images for mobile devices", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "designing a business card reader ( bcr ) for mobile devices is a challenge to the researchers because of huge deformation in acquired images , multiplicity in nature of the business cards and most importantly the computational constraints of the mobile devices"], ["BODY", "this paper presents a text extraction method designed in our work towards developing a bcr for mobile devices"], ["BODY", "at first , the background of a camera captured image is eliminated at a coarse level"], ["BODY", "then , various rule based techniques are applied on the connected components ( cc ) to filter out the noises and picture regions"], ["BODY", "the ccs identified as text are then binarized using an adaptive but light-weight binarization technique"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments show that the text extraction accuracy is around 98 % for a wide range of resolutions with varying computation time and memory requirements"], ["CONCLUSION", "the optimum performance is achieved for the images of resolution 1024x768 pixels with text extraction accuracy of 98.54 % and , space and time requirements as 1.1 mb and 0.16 seconds respectively ."]], "topics": ["time complexity", "computation"]}

{"title": "pros and cons of gan evaluation measures", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "generative models , in particular generative adverserial networks ( gans ) , have received a lot of attention recently"], ["INTRODUCTION", "a number of gan variants have been proposed and have been utilized in many applications"], ["INTRODUCTION", "despite large strides in terms of theoretical progress , evaluating and comparing gans remains a daunting task"], ["INTRODUCTION", "while several measures have been introduced , as of yet , there is no consensus as to which measure best captures strengths and limitations of models and should be used for fair model comparison"], ["INTRODUCTION", "as in other areas of computer vision and machine learning , it is critical to settle on one or few good measures to steer the progress in this field"], ["BODY", "in this paper , i review and critically discuss more than 19 quantitative and 4 qualitative measures for evaluating generative models with a particular emphasis on gan-derived models ."]], "topics": ["generative model", "computer vision"]}
{"title": "probabilistic combination of classifier and cluster ensembles for non-transductive learning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "unsupervised models can provide supplementary soft constraints to help classify new target data under the assumption that similar objects in the target set are more likely to share the same class label"], ["INTRODUCTION", "such models can also help detect possible differences between training and target distributions , which is useful in applications where concept drift may take place"], ["BODY", "this paper describes a bayesian framework that takes as input class labels from existing classifiers ( designed based on labeled data from the source domain ) , as well as cluster labels from a cluster ensemble operating solely on the target data to be classified , and yields a consensus labeling of the target data"], ["BODY", "this framework is particularly useful when the statistics of the target data drift or change from those of the training data"], ["CONCLUSION", "we also show that the proposed framework is privacy-aware and allows performing distributed learning when data/models have sharing restrictions"], ["CONCLUSION", "experiments show that our framework can yield superior results to those provided by applying classifier ensembles only ."]], "topics": ["test set"]}
{"title": "dialogue act tagging with transformation-based learning", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "for the task of recognizing dialogue acts , we are applying the transformation-based learning ( tbl ) machine learning algorithm"], ["BODY", "to circumvent a sparse data problem , we extract values of well-motivated features of utterances , such as speaker direction , punctuation marks , and a new feature , called dialogue act cues , which we find to be more effective than cue phrases and word n-grams in practice"], ["BODY", "we present strategies for constructing a set of dialogue act cues automatically by minimizing the entropy of the distribution of dialogue acts in a training corpus , filtering out irrelevant dialogue act cues , and clustering semantically-related words"], ["BODY", "in addition , to address limitations of tbl , we introduce a monte carlo strategy for training efficiently and a committee method for computing confidence measures"], ["CONCLUSION", "these ideas are combined in our working implementation , which labels held-out data as accurately as any other reported system for the dialogue act tagging task ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "value ( ethics )"]}
{"title": "classification of segments in polsar imagery by minimum stochastic distances between wishart distributions", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "a new classifier for polarimetric sar ( polsar ) images is proposed and assessed in this paper"], ["BODY", "its input consists of segments , and each one is assigned the class which minimizes a stochastic distance"], ["BODY", "assuming the complex wishart model , several stochastic distances are obtained from the h-phi family of divergences , and they are employed to derive hypothesis test statistics that are also used in the classification process"], ["BODY", "this article also presents , as a novelty , analytic expressions for the test statistics based on the following stochastic distances between complex wishart models : kullback-leibler , bhattacharyya , hellinger , r\\'enyi , and chi-square ; also , the test statistic based on the bhattacharyya distance between multivariate gaussian distributions is presented"], ["BODY", "the classifier performance is evaluated using simulated and real polsar data"], ["BODY", "the simulated data are based on the complex wishart model , aiming at the analysis of the proposal well controlled data"], ["CONCLUSION", "the real data refer to the complex l-band image , acquired during the 1994 sir-c mission"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results of the proposed classifier are compared with those obtained by a wishart per-pixel/contextual classifier , and we show the better performance of the region-based classification"], ["CONCLUSION", "the influence of the statistical modeling is assessed by comparing the results using the bhattacharyya distance between multivariate gaussian distributions for amplitude data"], ["CONCLUSION", "the results with simulated data indicate that the proposed classification method has a very good performance when the data follow the wishart model"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed classifier also performs better than the per-pixel/contextual classifier and the bhattacharyya gaussian distance using sir-c polsar data ."]], "topics": ["simulation", "pixel"]}
{"title": "partial sum minimization of singular values representation on grassmann manifolds", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "as a significant subspace clustering method , low rank representation ( lrr ) has attracted great attention in recent years"], ["INTRODUCTION", "to further improve the performance of lrr and extend its applications , there are several issues to be resolved"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the nuclear norm in lrr does not sufficiently use the prior knowledge of the rank which is known in many practical problems"], ["INTRODUCTION", "the lrr is designed for vectorial data from linear spaces , thus not suitable for high dimensional data with intrinsic non-linear manifold structure"], ["BODY", "this paper proposes an extended lrr model for manifold-valued grassmann data which incorporates prior knowledge by minimizing partial sum of singular values instead of the nuclear norm , namely partial sum minimization of singular values representation ( gpssvr )"], ["BODY", "the new model not only enforces the global structure of data in low rank , but also retains important information by minimizing only smaller singular values"], ["BODY", "to further maintain the local structures among grassmann points , we also integrate the laplacian penalty with gpssvr"], ["BODY", "an effective algorithm is proposed to solve the optimization problem based on the gpssvr model"], ["CONCLUSION", "the proposed model and algorithms are assessed on some widely used human action video datasets and a real scenery dataset"], ["CONCLUSION", "the experimental results show that the proposed methods obviously outperform other state-of-the-art methods ."]], "topics": ["cluster analysis", "data mining"]}
{"title": "political speech generation", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "in this report we present a system that can generate political speeches for a desired political party"], ["BODY", "furthermore , the system allows to specify whether a speech should hold a supportive or opposing opinion"], ["BODY", "the system relies on a combination of several state-of-the-art nlp methods which are discussed in this report"], ["BODY", "these include n-grams , justeson & katz pos tag filter , recurrent neural networks , and latent dirichlet allocation"], ["BODY", "sequences of words are generated based on probabilities obtained from two underlying models : a language model takes care of the grammatical correctness while a topic model aims for textual consistency"], ["BODY", "both models were trained on the convote dataset which contains transcripts from us congressional floor debates"], ["CONCLUSION", "furthermore , we present a manual and an automated approach to evaluate the quality of generated speeches"], ["CONCLUSION", "in an experimental evaluation generated speeches have shown very high quality in terms of grammatical correctness and sentence transitions ."]], "topics": ["natural language processing", "recurrent neural network"]}
{"title": "rollout sampling policy iteration for decentralized pomdps", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we present decentralized rollout sampling policy iteration ( decrspi ) - a new algorithm for multi-agent decision problems formalized as dec-pomdps"], ["BODY", "decrspi is designed to improve scalability and tackle problems that lack an explicit model"], ["BODY", "the algorithm uses monte- carlo methods to generate a sample of reachable belief states"], ["BODY", "then it computes a joint policy for each belief state based on the rollout estimations"], ["BODY", "a new policy representation allows us to represent solutions compactly"], ["BODY", "the key benefits of the algorithm are its linear time complexity over the number of agents , its bounded memory usage and good solution quality"], ["CONCLUSION", "it can solve larger problems that are intractable for existing planning algorithms"], ["CONCLUSION", "experimental results confirm the effectiveness and scalability of the approach ."]], "topics": ["time complexity", "iteration"]}
{"title": "one-shot learning in discriminative neural networks", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "we consider the task of one-shot learning of visual categories"], ["BODY", "in this paper we explore a bayesian procedure for updating a pretrained convnet to classify a novel image category for which data is limited"], ["BODY", "we decompose this convnet into a fixed feature extractor and softmax classifier"], ["BODY", "we assume that the target weights for the new task come from the same distribution as the pretrained softmax weights , which we model as a multivariate gaussian"], ["CONCLUSION", "by using this as a prior for the new weights , we demonstrate competitive performance with state-of-the-art methods whilst also being consistent with 'normal ' methods for training deep networks on large data ."]], "topics": ["test set", "mathematical optimization"]}
{"title": "spatial mapping with gaussian processes and nonstationary fourier features", "abstract": [["INTRODUCTION", "the use of covariance kernels is ubiquitous in the field of spatial statistics"], ["INTRODUCTION", "kernels allow data to be mapped into high-dimensional feature spaces and can thus extend simple linear additive methods to nonlinear methods with higher order interactions"], ["INTRODUCTION", "however , until recently , there has been a strong reliance on a limited class of stationary kernels such as the matern or squared exponential , limiting the expressiveness of these modelling approaches"], ["INTRODUCTION", "recent machine learning research has focused on spectral representations to model arbitrary stationary kernels and introduced more general representations that include classes of nonstationary kernels"], ["BODY", "in this paper , we exploit the connections between fourier feature representations , gaussian processes and neural networks to generalise previous approaches and develop a simple and efficient framework to learn arbitrarily complex nonstationary kernel functions directly from the data , while taking care to avoid overfitting using state-of-the-art methods from deep learning"], ["BODY", "we highlight the very broad array of kernel classes that could be created within this framework"], ["BODY", "we apply this to a time series dataset and a remote sensing problem involving land surface temperature in eastern africa"], ["CONCLUSION", "we show that without increasing the computational or storage complexity , nonstationary kernels can be used to improve generalisation performance and provide more interpretable results ."]], "topics": ["kernel ( operating system )", "time series"]}
